3. Exit a piece (exit meeple to score points)
4. Place a blocker (disk that blocks meeple into a space)
5. Jump a piece (over an opponents piece when you have two pieces next to one opponent piece).

Components
High impact Plastic board
10 wooden Meeples (5 Blue, 5 Red)
6 wooden discs (3 Blue, 3 Red)
Rules (1 page)
Game Variants and Strategy Tips (1 page)
Ziplock Bag

173185.name: Ascendant
173185.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling action game. Improve abilities by finding and buying upgrades. Equip different blessings to fit your playstyle.

Unlockable characters and randomly generated rooms and events increase replay value. Supports two player local co-op.

173186.name: Idlecurse Caves
173186.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A huge map showing a series of winding caves and tunnels. With daylight streaming in from the only surface entrance, adventurers push deeper into the darkness of the caverns. Filled with strange fungi, moss and dirt, the caverns may be home to all manner of denizens. Deep within the cave system is a lake, and part of an underground river races through the darkness.

Uses: Arrive in the caverns via the subterranean river and seek an exit to the surface, delve into the darkness to find the lost children, avoid the traps of goblins, troglodytes, frogmen and other foul creatures.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)




Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

173187.name: Norman's Gone Missing
173187.description:
Designer's Summary:

Norman, a potter, has gone missing. The locals ask for help finding him. The party may very well halt a problem before it becomes a bad situation in the process.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173188.name: The Skeleton Crew
173188.description:
From the Introduction:

A homestead to the east has been attacked by undead. The priest, Opulus, led a handful of men to battle these abominations. But one of the locals has returned and reports Opulus is trapped and needs help.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173189.name: The Pig and the Ogre
173189.description:
From the Introduction:

An ogre was spotted in the forest outside the village. The northern crops were heavily damaged. If more fields are harmed the villagers will not have enough food for the winter.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173190.name: The Pierced Children
173190.description:
From the Introduction:

People within the city and outlying villages have become gravely ill. The only lead is a guard patrol spotted a small band of orogs towards the hills. The guards suspect the orogs poisoned the water. If something isn’t done quickly, many will die.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173191.name: Ghost Ship
173191.description:
From the Introduction:

The party’s boat enters a light fog bank. Within the fog bank is a small merchant vessel listing to the side. Talking can be heard in side the ship.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173192.name: Crypt of Volkov
173192.description:
From the Introduction:

The door to this ancient mausoleum has been torn from the stonework and discarded outside the entrance. Water smoothed, stone steps descend into the darkness.

Designer's Summary:

I wanted to do more of a traditional dungeon crawl this time around. A crypt with some rooms and bad things inside. Hope you guys enjoy....

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173193.name: Sixteen Stone
173193.description: Sixteen Stone is an abstract strategy game played on a 5x5 grid. Each player has 8 stones in either red or blue. The objective of the game is to remove all of your opponents stones from the board by either pushing them off of the board or by capturing them. Sixteen Stone was placed into the Public Domain on 12/3/2015 by the Designer.

173194.name: Temple of Selig
173194.description:
From the Introduction:

Rumors of a temple, deep within the forest have been tossed around the tavern tables for years. While the stories have been a favorite, none of those telling the story have seen it, except for one. His arms ended in stumps and he rambles on about, "The temple, it’s alive."

This is micro-adventure can be used alone or it can be played with MSA #1 Misanthrope Islands.

Designer's Summary:

Another micro-adventure is in the books. This adventure can go along with the micro-sandbox MSB #1 Misanthrope Islands or run alone. I've included files that have the background and without one. And a player's map. Enjoy!

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173195.name: Hideout of the Long Dead Mardrid
173195.description:
From the Introduction:

A few years ago Mardrid was one of the most successful bandits in the area. He worked alone and was an expert at targeting his victims. He never killed any of his patrons and some reported, "he was a pleasant fellow". There were rumors of the location of his hideout and the small horde it contained. No one has seen Mardrid in over two years. In recent days folks have been finding silver and gold coins in the creek.

Designer's Summary:

Here's a side adventure that may attract the players. A few coins have been washed down the local creek and there have always been rumors that Mardrid, a notorious bandit, kept a hideout nearby. To get inside they'll have to swim up the creek without a paddle (I couldn't help myself).

Mardrid didn't fair so well after one of his thefts and now lingers in the cavern feeling sorry for himself and waiting to extract revenge. In the meantime, the players can get away with a lot of loot without having to fight anything.

I've played with the level draining ability of Mardrid. He uses the captured life as a bargaining chip to retrieve the only person he's ever wanted to kill. Bring her to him and all life will be restored and Mardrid can finally rest.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173196.name: Misanthrope Islands (with Adventures)
173196.description:
From the Introduction:

These islands have always been trouble for merchants and pirates ships. The angry sea plays no favorite here. Deadly creatures inhabit both land and sea. But there are the other rumors, rumors that the sea floor between the Misanthrope Islands is littered with bones and gold. Foolish men believe it is theirs for the taking.

Designer's Summary:

This was an unusual one. I had only intended to make a normal micro-adventure out of it, but as I worked on it became my first micro-sandbox setting. Within this are other micro-adventures that I'll be producing later in the month. I have to thank Tim Knight for the idea seed for this one. He wanted some islands, he got them.

User summary:

A Micro Sandbox published on the Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

this printed edition includes
Micro Sandbox #01: Misanthrope Islands
Micro Adventure #07: Gargoyle Lair
Micro Adventure #08: Temple of Selig

173197.name: The Lost Treasure of the Bone Soldiers
173197.description:
Designer's Summary:

I introduce a group in this adventure, but I don't give any background. Bone Soldiers. Anyone who has read Starter Adventures will find mention of them in magic-user entry, On the Road. Bone Soldiers are a group of folks dedicated to the necromantic arts. One of their artifact was hidden here many years ago. To get players interested in the adventure I was thinking of just throwing a treasure map in the way. A crude thing that mentions buried treasure. Simple, but effective.

This adventure is short, but thick with character ending possibilities. First there is the simple you fall a 100' and turn into broken meat sack. Then there is the harpies charm ability, depending on the game this could be a permanent situation. And lastly, the life draining ability of the wraith. That ain't no joke.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173198.name: Ossuary of a Death God
173198.description:
Designer's Summary:

It's been a little while since I last posted an adventure. I had a couple of false starts on others. But I'm happy to bring you, Ossuary of a Death God. This is a mid to high level adventure. It deals with a god killer called the adversary and the possibility of reanimation of a death god.

I don't give any background to the adventure. This is one of those sites that the GM can throw at the players to alter their view of the world. I have named the death god Ballor, he is one of nine, but this is easy enough to change for your own campaign. And the adversary becomes is an interesting, powerful thing in your campaign world. I can see him playing a part in many things.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

173199.name: Brittle Bone Lake
173199.description:
From the Introduction

A month ago, some fancy boy rode through here, he wore armor without a scratch on it. No proper armor is without dents and blood. He spoke loud, but a man without a notch on his blade has little to say worth the spit he sprays. He wanted information about Brittle Bone Lake. Most laughed at the fancy, some told him to go home to his nursemaids, but Jundry, gave him directions. Do I have to say Jundry has no love for the fancy folks? Haven’t seen the boy since. I bet that armor is proper now.

Designer's Summary:

Brittle Bone Lake came about because of my drowsy Google+ surfing. I saw some very cool maps by Kristian Richards and wanted to give a go with it. I drew the map that;s included and thought it came out well. And when I saw the map my mind went back to that Trampier picture of the catoblepas rearing its head out of the water that was in the old Monster Manuel. So I grabbed my pencil and scribbled some notes and whamo.

Brittle Bone Lake is a small location to place in your campaign. You'll meet Sir Tusks, a catoblepas who minds his own business. Locals like when adventurers come through to spend their coin. What the adventurers and locals don't understand is that Sir Tusks keeps the area free of other hostiles.

User summary:

A Micro Encounter published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

boardgameintegration: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Melee at Murdershroom Marsh
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Melee at Murdershroom Marsh
173200.description:
The sleeper hit has awakened! Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill is finally here and it’s loaded with all-new ways to deliver a smoking death to all who oppose you. This stand-alone game is also 100% compatible with the original game, which allows players to turn an already epic game into an EPIC game. Epic Spell Wars continues its epic quest after airing on TableTop on Geek and Sundry! Featuring game design and all-new art from the original creative team of Cory Jones, Rob Heinsoo, and Nick Edwards.

New Addition: Creatures! Delivery cards in this set can also become your pets if you roll well enough. With a familiar by your side for a few rounds, you’ll be unstoppable. But if a big splash of damage is heading your way, why not have your little buddy jump in the way and take that blast instead of you?

New Addition: Blood! Collect Blood as you slay your opponents and tempt fate with powerful magiks and treasures. Use your Blood points to make some spells even more powerful than before.

New Addition: Reactions! A few spells will partially resolve even if you die too soon. Now you can play a full-strength spell without fretting about dying before it resolves. With a Reaction in there, you’ll get your revenge…

New Addition: The Standee matters! That crazy stand-up piece is now a coveted heirloom in the game. If you control it, several of your spells will increase in strength. It can also earn you some extra Blood.

Whether you have played the original or not, this new set will provide everything you need to start blasting your opponents into tiny bits of goo. Experienced players will find new challenges and they’ll marvel at the all-new Treasures and Dead Wizard cards as well. Mix the two sets together for the ultimate carnage-fest!
173200.name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill
boardgameexpansion: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Dr. Hannah and Wilhellion Promo Cards
boardgamefamily: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards

173207.name: TGABA
173207.description:
TGABA (Trivia Game About Black Americans) can be played by two or more players, or by a group divided into teams. A moderator is needed to ask questions and decide which participant answers correctly and fastest.

One questions is asked for each card. The team answering each question correctly "owns" that card; the team "owning" the greatest number of cards at the end of the game is the winner.

173209.name: Knight Fight
173209.description:
Knight Fight is a dice game for two players lasting around 5 minutes, that sees two brave Knights face off in mortal combat. The objective of the game is to score three hits on your opponent.

The game is played with two sets of polyhedral dice: d4, d6, d8, d10x2, d12 and d20. The d4, d6, and d8 represent weapons, the d10 gauntlets, the d12 a helmet and d20 a shield.

The game is set up by both players rolling their d12. The result is each players' Defence number. The number the opposing player needs to beat to score a hit on them. This Defence can be added to when the player chooses to Defend.

Players secretly choose dice to roll, and roll them simultaneously onto the table. Players can choose to Attack (with a weapon and a gauntlet), Defend (with a weapon or a shield), Jostle/Disarm (with a Gauntlet) or Regather (where a player only feigns to roll dice, allowing them to return dice rolled on previous turns to their hand).

The dice results are compared and players may retrieve only one of their rolled dice, the rest are "placed with their squire".

The game can be played using optional Knight and Items cards that introduce variable player powers and greater tactical depth.

173212.name: The World of Peter and the Monsters
173212.description:
From the introduction:

The Peter and the Monsters novels tell of the many spooky adventures of young Peter Normal. Like many stories for young people, they are equally fun for adults - and in this case, a great setting for role-playing, too!

173213.name: Forest Argent
173213.description:
From the Introduction:

The Forest Argent game set in a strange world; it is not a world in and of itself, more a strange series of shifting paths and glades that open sometimes to connect to true worlds rather than the Forest Argent's strange "between place".
Worlds with strange peoples, not always human, some have magic, some have strange deviations from science leaving them with high jackets and muskets but alchemy nearly miraculous in its many uses.
The game allows you to play one of these people, to explore strange lands and take part in the politics and conflicts of those worlds.
The game is largely designed to be one where people are specialists and working as a team for mutual survival despite conflicting social mores or long-term goals.

We are in the business of running a game all about exploration, about people going to new worlds and having to deal with things well beyond their ken.
We have tried to write the rules so that though there is movement characters can choose how quickly they progress and what career paths they wish to take.
It also allows (in fact we strongly promote) characters to make their own equipment, explore new avenues of investigation and invention.

The Referees are always the final arbitrators of the rules but we always welcome feedback, which we will either take on board or give an explanation as to why not.

The most important part of this is to Have Fun; if it isn't then you need to let us know and we will do our best to accommodate you.

173214.name: Forest Argent Primer
173214.description:
From the Introduction:

This is a necessary primer to help you make sense of the Forest Argent game world as it gets bigger & bigger.

It takes into account the differences between the game worlds and how the societies affect the Rules.

It can be used to override the current rules to show the differences between worlds and expands the way that the worlds work.

173215.name: The Expendabros
173215.description:
User Summary

A free game, very similar to Broforce. This game was made freely available to promote the new action movie Expendables 3.

When you start playing you get a random character assigned. It's name is one of the action movie characters, with "bro" somewhere mixed in, like "Barney Ross" is now "Broney Ross" and "Toll Road" now "Toll Broad". The character somehow wield the favorite weapon of the movie character, like "Bro Christmas" wielding knives and "Broney Ross" an assault rifle.

Unlike the non-free Broforce, this game only supports single player and local multiplayer (2 persons on 1 keyboard).

173217.name: Super Stickman Golf 2
videogamehonor: 2013 CVA Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
173217.description:
User Summary

Super Stickman Golf 2 is the sequel to Super Stickman Golf.

173218.name: Misanthrope Islands
173218.description:
From the Introduction:

These islands have always been trouble for merchants and pirates ships. The angry sea plays no favorite here. Deadly creatures inhabit both land and sea. But there are the other rumors, rumors that the sea floor between the Misanthrope Islands is littered with bones and gold. Foolish men believe it is theirs for the taking.

User Summary:

A Micro Sandbox setting, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173219.name: Gargoyle Lair
173219.description:
Designer's Summary:

Here's #7, the Gargoyle Lair. This one can be run alone or it can be integrated into the micro-sandbox MSB #1 Misanthrope Islands. Either way the gargoyles will be not too pleased to find adventurers within their sacred caves.

From the Introduction:

The granite hillside looks like a large hive. These ancient caves predate even the stone giants that once dominated the area. The caves have been home to gargoyles for over 1000 years. The gargoyles are aware of the party. They hope to trap them between the gargoyles inside the caves and the watchers outside.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173220.name: Madness in the Earth
173220.description:
Designer's Summary:

I let this adventure rip a little more than the others. This one is longer in content and not restricted to the one-page format. This allowed me to use a bigger font and add a little more detailed content. This is a low level adventure with a minor artifact at the end. While it is powerful it could easily kill the players. Enjoy the adventure!

From the Introduction:

A small mining operation has not picked up their supplies for the past two weeks. The mining operation consists of three individuals; Ted, a human with buck teeth; Chuck, a halfling who owes people money; and Burg, a dwarf who has an endless supply of dirty jokes. Yesterday, Burg was seen running through the fields naked, screaming. A few hours later he was seen running through the fields again. Still naked. Still screaming.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173221.name: Village of the Plague Zombies
173221.description:
Designer's Summary:

Here's the 10th micro-adventure. Boy, that went quick. I allowed myself to go beyond the one-page format because I wanted to use a larger font. I'm too old to try and read a font that looks like mice ran over the paper with inky feet. Enjoy Village of the Plague Zombies. Think of a B-horror flick on a Saturday night with a big ass bowl of popcorn. That's how I see this adventure.

From the Introduction:

No one from the village has been heard from in the past week. The reeve did not deliver his required amount of grain to the manor. The lord of the manor wants his grain, the folks want to know if their friends and family are safe. The guards report they have engaged walking corpses along the road. With the harvest, no one has the extra time or resources to investigate. Adventurers go forth and do what you do.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173222.name: Brom's Raiders
173222.description:
From the Introduction:

Orc raiders have caused problems for the area. Some report a human is among them, along with a larger humanoid thing. The orcs attacked one of Lord Banister’s wagons. He lost two family heirlooms and anxiously wants them returned. Locals say that relatives are missing. Dragged toward the hills.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173223.name: The Path Not Chosen
173223.description:
Designer's Summary:

Here is a creepy little encounter that you can throw at your party as they travel through the woods. It is a simple encounter, but I think it will mess with some of your players. And there is a potential for a on-going NPC the players will have to contend with.

From the Introduction:

The players are walking along a hunting trail when they find three men laying in the undergrowth. It’s obvious they were attacked, large gaping wounds in the shoulders and chest. One of the bodies has his head partially severed. Two of the men look to have been mercenaries, randomly pieced together armor and a tattoo under their right eye that signifies they were once criminals. The third slain is a woman dressed in peasant clothes. Her hands are tied behind her back and a gag in her mouth.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173224.name: Unfinished Abbey of the Chanter
173224.description:
Designer's Summary:

Here's a little evil cult infusion into your game, The Chanter. An old religion being revived. Worshiping The Chanter will get your executed in most civilized areas. People are finding sacrificial altars in the forest with animals offered to the once forgotten god. Now, people have gone missing. This shit just got serious.

From the Introduction:

There’s been a revival of an old time religion called The Chanter. The religion was banned many years ago because its ritual sacrifices. In recent months, there have been makeshift altars found in the forest with various animal sacrifices. Two days ago, Richard, a farmer went missing. The locals fear he has been taken by the chanters.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173225.name: Chambers Island
173225.description:
Designer's Summary:

Chambers Island was originally a Cthulhu influenced island located in the middle of the swamp. Because of space I had to expunge most of that text, but I may revisit it. It would have been nearly twice as long.

This adventure includes a nasty creature I don't think I have ever used before, a spirit naga. It will make a formidable opponent.

I've included the PDF of the adventure, a detailed GM map and a blank players map.

I developed this adventure around an old keep with out buildings. The image of the players approaching the island with a crumbling tower with a batch of buildings in various states of decay. Include the corpses hanging from trees and I really wanted to capture as much of that as I could.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173226.name: Chardoom Swamp
173226.description:
Designer's Summary:

Another foray into the swamp. This time the party will find themselves in the inhospitable region of the Chardoom Swamp. Once infested with lizardmen, they to have abandon their holy land. Chardoom has new tenants, ones the have made the swamp even more deadly.

Originally I was going to design this as a micro-hexcrawl. One of the unmarked islands is where Chambers Island would be located. And who knows I may populate another one of the islands down the line.

Chardoom Swamp is nasty because the environment is especially troublesome to the party and is really the biggest obstacle in the adventure. While the party will encounter big bad guys, it is the swamp that is relentless in its attack and will slowly drain the party of resources and life.

From the Introduction:

The Chardoom Swamp was an isolated and sacred land of the lizardmen. The deadly waters, carnivorous plant life and dangerous creatures make Chardoom Swamp the most unhospitable area in the land.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173227.name: Possum Stop
173227.description:
Designer's Summary:

A while ago I released a PWYW product called Execution Corner, it was a small site with personality. It was meant, like my micro-adventures, to be easily dropped into a campaign if the GM needed something to throw at the players as they traveled. Possum Stop is in that same vein. It's a in between place that folks can stop at, ride through or pick up an adventure or two.

It's a simple three structure location with a home of a potato farmer, a small tavern and a odd shrine dedicated to the possum god.

From the Introduction:

Possum Stop is a tiny location that is halfway from here-to-there. It features the Calugula Tavern, Borden’s Farm and the Possum Chapel. Folks stop here to get water for their horses, ale for themselves and occasional ask for the blessing from the nocturnal nature god, Posimium the Possum God.

User Summary:

A Micro Location, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173228.name: Rose Garden
173228.description:
The game is played on an 8x8 board representing a garden.

There are two players – White and Red. Each player has sixteen pieces consisting of:


A piece of garden Décor
Three Queens
A dozen Roses


The garden Décor (a statue and a bench) once set does not move and cannot be captured by either side. In other words, they act as permanent Blocks.

The Queens move and capture just like Chess Queens.

The Roses, once placed, do not move.

The game is played in two phases – “Planting” and “Gathering”

Planting: The players first each set their own piece of Décor on any empty space on the board. This is then followed by their Queens. The players must place their Queens so no Queen can immediately attack an opponent’s Queen. Lastly, all the Roses are arranged around the board, in any remaining empty spaces.

Gathering: Once all the pieces are set, players then can move their Queens around the board, capturing an opponent’s pieces – both Roses and Queens.

Goal - There are two different ways to win:

Capture all twelve of your opponent’s Roses
Capture all three of your opponent’s Queens

173229.name: Modern Monks Urban Fantasy
173229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Urban Fantasy is a supplement designed for players and game masters running campaigns with the Modern Monks role playing game. Inside you will find new skills, new Techs, and new spells inspired by the original game that Modern Monks was inspired by. Urban Fantasy also contains 17 new specialties including the mysterious ninja, the sly street rat, the dreaded anti-paladin, and many more!

173230.name: The Witch Hunter (New Base Class)
173230.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new base character class, the Witch Hunter. The Witch Hunter has the unique abilities to resist the hex powers of witches and can disrupt the special bonds between familiars and their masters, coupled with the ability to cast limited divine spells from their own spell list.

173231.name: Duelist
173231.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the prestige class of the Duelist, those swashbuckling swordfighters full of grace, poise, and acrobatic skill.

The feats you'll find inside:

Attack of Humiliation - Anger your oppenent
Effective Level Increase - Increase your effectivness in certain situations
Enhanced Combat Reflexes - Have better combat reflexes
Increased Minimum Damage - Increase the minimumamount of damage of your melee attacks
Master of Parry - Failed a parray check? Roll again
Supple Body - Certain saves are now a tad easier
Threatening pose - Show off what you could do , but choose not to

173232.name: Shrike Pirate Gunship
173232.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 300 dT not jump capable gunship.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

173233.name: Mythic Weapons
173233.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Weapons is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to mythic magic items that create unique mythic effects. Some can be used only by mythic wielders, while others are useful for all characters but have effects enhanced or new abilities unlocked in the hands of mythic wielders. Mythic Weapons brings you 4 brand-new items: the blade-eating battleaxe, kinslayer's kukri, redflame trollblade, and silverspark longbow!

173234.name: Plague: Land of the Dead
173234.description:
Survive an undead apocalypse and deliver the cure to eliminate the pandemic. Players work together to save humanity from near certain doom.

Simulating Hordes of Zombies migrating throughout a metropolis, players move through the city attempting to combine elements of a cure to eliminate the Zombie infestation.

Each Player chooses a different Role to play for the game with a variety of different abilities and carrying capacities. With Five Roles to choose from players must develop different strategies every game in order to fight off the multitude of zombie hordes.

The five roles are; Sniper, Hunter, Medic, Mechanic and Scavenger.

Gather Weapons, Equipment, and Vehicles.
Store Supplies: Food, Ammo, Medicine, and Fuel in Hideouts.

No Dice - No Complicated Rules - Easy and Fun to Play

173236.name: ATC: Rush Hours
173236.description:
ATC Rush Hour is a game in which players take role of Air Traffic Controllers on an airport. The main objective of the game is to make sure that all the planes land or take off without any problems. The game will is available to play from 4 to 6 players. Each player controls one airport with its ATC (Air Traffic Controllers) and try to take off and land as many planes as possible.

Each player receives one board at the start of the game. The board represents an airport that is controlled by the player and it is divided into five Zones and seven spaces for Action cards. The Zones are used as an areas to place ATC and Plane cards and the other spaces are destined for corresponding Action cards (Airport, Upgrade, Event and Weather).

The key element of the game is moving the Planes between the Zones and players. The Planes are moved by sending them ATC commands. To send a command to a Plane, a player must pay with ATC points, which is done by removing a number of counters from ATC cards. Moving Planes provides victory points which are needed to win the game.

173240.description:
You are a monkey who run fruit farms. Plant seeds to grow your fruits and pick it for getting new farms. Easy-to-Learn family strategy game with mancala-mechanic.

There are some differences between 1st and 2nd. Changed rules, added four Rain Cards and a Market Sheet.
173240.name: Fruit Picking

173241.name: What The Fact
173241.description:
What the Fact (WTF) is an outrageously fun, quick & easy (like your mom) party game. Dice make the game about the players & what you'll post on social media to win.

A player selects a black card and rolls the dice to find out which player the card is about. Each of the other players turn in a gray card that fills in the blank and completes the fact. The person giving the most outrageous card wins the round.

The dice symbol represents whichever name came up on the dice. Where it gets even more interesting: if you roll a "WTF", the card is up for grabs! The symbol then represents YOUR OWN NAME and the first person to post the phrase online gets the point. This could lead to some interesting What The Fact moments!

173242.name: The Fantasy Codex
173242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Empower your Wizard!

Almost a thousand new spells for your fantasy game, detailed and organized for use by GMs and Players alike. Designed and officially licensed for Fantasy Hero by Kestrel Arts, this collection of magic may be adapted for any fantasy setting.

Unlock spells like Grimstaff’s Grand Enhancement, Cinder Spray, Tornado, and Call Aether Spite! Learn magical spells from five different orders and seventeen magical schools! Summon not just elementals but a keep or siege weapons! Cast spells to baffle and confound your enemies! The Fantasy Codex is packed with unique and creative magic for your spell caster to learn and use... and for your GM to use against you.

173243.description:
The Werewolf awake at the midnight, and touches Villager's fingers. Who touched your finger? Very simple and fun party game.

This game is made as Postcard Game.
173243.name: Finger Werewolf

173244.name: Quintix
173244.description:
You control the destiny of five fearless warriors. You will battle your way through three types of terrain: the damp Darkwoods, the rugged mountains, and the open plains. On your quest you will encounter trolls, deadly Knights and face attacks from every side. It is your mission to advance your satyr through the regions of battle, avoiding the death traps and protecting him at all costs. Because if you're satyr dies, your chance of winning the war dies with him.

Players roll dice to move around a track, through different regions of the board, and attack the other player by again rolling dice and comparing to a combat resolution chart to modify the rolls.

173245.description:
Final Attack! is a real-time cooperative tabletop strategy game for 1-5 players. You will pilot the K-Machines, ancient yet technologically advanced fighting mecha that can combine to form Final Kaiser, champion of justice. You will do battle against shapeshifting mechanical monsters called Robeasts, gigantic foot soldiers of the starfaring artificial intelligence FANGER. Your only way to defeat these terrors is to use the Final Attack, an all-powerful weapon that takes the entire game to charge.

Final Attack! is a unique blend of card game, worker placement game, social game, and arcade game. You will play cards, you will move chips around the table, you will solve resource puzzles, you will yell attack names, and you will endure hardship by yourself or with whatever companions fate has provided, all in real time. The game takes between 20 and 30 minutes to play, and there is absolutely nothing else like it.
173245.name: Final Attack!

173246.name: #Harshmode Monday (#14 - Feb 9, 2015)
173246.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

173247.name: Clan of the Frog
173247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Frog temples, ray guns, and more.

Products of alchemical evolution, members of the Frog Clans and their allies represent two new playable races of humanoid amphibians. Hailing from a mysterious land beyond the stars, these races now preside over ancient frog temples in the hearts of swamps everywhere. Led by templars equipped with technological relics and altered through strange alchemical and surgical experiments, these new races showcase dozens of new character options.

Spur your continuing evolution with new alchemist discoveries. Become a test subject for experimental body modification procedures. Wield circuit-threaded weapons, ray guns, and other strange gear. Worship at the altar of high technology with a new Technology cleric domain. All of these options and more are available to the boggards of the Frog Clans and to other characters who cross their path.

boardgameintegration: Story Time Dice: Fairy Tales
Story Time Dice: Scary Tales
Story Time Dice: Fairy Tales
Story Time Dice: Scary Tales
173248.name: Story Time Dice
173248.description:
From publisher's website:

As long as there has been language, there has been storytelling. One of our oldest traditions, passed down from generation to generation for thousands of years, it's a great way to teach, to learn, or to just have fun! And it has never needed a screen or batteries.

Now it's your turn to roll your very own story with Story Time Dice! Suitable for all ages and any number of players, these seven big, chunky polyhedral dice come in a variety of fun shapes, and with a quick roll will help you spin a million grand tales. Pit 12 heroes against 10 villains in 6 settings, using 20 tools and 8 vehicles to overcome 6 obstacles and claim 6 prizes! Can you create an adventure in which a lost diver thwarts a robot in a haunted house using music and a time warp to collect a valuable treasure? It's all up to the dice, and your imagination!

This Story Time Dice set includes:
3 six-sided dice with settings, obstacles and prizes
1 eight-sided vehicles die
1 ten-sided villains die
1 twelve-sided heroes die
1 twenty-sided tools die
1 guide to every icon on the dice
4 recommended games to play: Once Upon a Time, One by One, Heroes & Villains (see below), and Rescue Operation

Once Upon a Time and One by One are different styles of storytelling.

Rescue Operation
Have each player roll the hero die and the vehicle or tool dice to determine his/her character and their abilities. When all players have finished, one player rolls the villain, obstacle and setting dice and uses them to create a sticky situation for their character. The other players then must use their characters' abilities and teamwork to create a story in which they rescue their friend. The captured character can make their job more difficult by rolling more obstacles and villains into the story!

Heroes & Villains
One player rolls the hero die to create a character, then rolls the tool die three times and the vehicle die once to create their character's arsenal. The other player does the same, using the villain dice instead of the hero. The villain begins the story by using their character and arsenal to turn the situation against the hero. The hero then continues the story by trying to beat the villain. Players continue taking turns. The game is over when one player can't image how they could possibly win!

173249.name: Prying Eyes
173249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Book ten in the series takes a close look at prying eyes, one of the most powerful (and often underused) of the divination spells.

The book includes:

A point by point breakdown of how prying eyes works, detailing its advantages and limitations.
Advice for the GM on how to deal with prying eyes, comprising a number of different methods to make the spell quicker and easier to use.
Detailed, step by step details on creating commands, utilising a wide range of preset phrases.
Uses for prying eyes beyond simply scouting and information gathering.
A section detailing interesting statistics about prying eyes, including: the radius of ground an eye can scan while flying at different heights, how much area a prying eye can search in an hour, and the maximum radius a circle of eyes can have and see all creatures passing its perimeter.
19 example commands for prying eyes, each easily adaptable to fit a wide variety of different situations.
6 new spells.
8 new feats to enhance prying eyes.

173250.name: Bloodstone Protector Sarum (ICONS)
173250.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bloodstone Protectors are an amoral space-based "peace-keeping force" that effectively runs an interstellar protection racket.

Sarum Tral is a spymaster for the Bloodstone Protectorate. She cultivates a wide-ranging
network of informants and occasionally will conduct aggressive reconnaissance missions herself.

She's statted up and ready to provide a cosmic threat to the heroes in your ICONS game.

173251.description: Labyrinth: The Awakening, 2010 - ? expands on Labyrinth: The War on Terror, 2001 - ?, a 1-2 player card-driven board game simulating at the strategic level the ongoing bid by Islamic extremists to impose their brand of religious rule on the Muslim world. This expansion continues where Labyrinth left off adding new rules and cards to cover the last five years of history. Included are new mechanics to simulate the grass roots political movements of the Arab Spring and the resulting Civil Wars. Labyrinth: The Awakening provides 120 all new event cards, four new country mats, additional markers, cubes and cylinders, and 7 new scenarios, including 2 that are playable to conclusion in 7 turns or less.
173251.name: Labyrinth: The Awakening, 2010 – ?

173252.name: The Commander: A New Character Class
173252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by similar character classes in other games, this booklet brings the inspirational healing mechanics to your game through the commander: a class dedicated to healing without magic, in the tradition of marshalls and warlords from previous editions, but 100% compatible with the up to date rules of the World's greatest RPG!

Tired of clerics, druids and bards? Wish you could keep your allies on their feet without abandonning the gritty warrior archetype you really enjoy to play? If that's your case, we believe the commander is exactly what you need, complete with multiclassing rules and new feats to bring more of the rules presented here to your game.

173253.description: A Black Stories edition about dark tales from the realms of myth and legend.
173253.name: Black Stories: Dark Tales Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 40 - Interview with Red Raven Games Ryan Laukat

173254.name: Hold my hand
173254.description:
Hold my hand is a party card game for 4-8 players. Players are children lost in fairy forest, trying to get out without becoming fairies. Children are scared, and unaware that one of them might be a fairy.

The game is played drafting cards. In each turn players look at the cards in their hands, put one card either in front of themselves(1) or in between themselves and player next to them(2 or 3). (look at the picture). These cards are put face down.
Then pass rest of the cards to the left.
Then players decide which card that is in between will they look at...

You have the game and the rules in the files section, so just take a look ;)

173255.description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Orc Scout, Orc Shaman, Orc Charger), 2 new items (Rune Armor, Rune Stone), and 12 new story cards.
173255.name: Fallen: Ruined Stronghold Adventure Pack

173256.description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Fire Wisp, Stalker, Cave Drake), 2 new items (Charred Scales, Chains of Ilthor), and 12 new story cards.
173256.name: Fallen: Cataclysm Adventure Pack

173257.description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Spore Creeper, Rock Dervish, Bore Worm), 2 new items (Repeating Crossbow, Everlight), and 12 new story cards.
173257.name: Fallen: Underworld Adventure Pack

173258.description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Ghoul, Wight, True Thelastian), 2 new items (Revenant Tome, Unbound Servant), and 12 new story cards.
173258.name: Fallen: Dark Tower Adventure Pack

173259.description:
Fallen is a card and dice game in which two players battle deep within a dungeon. One player takes on the role of the Hero, exploring the twisting halls and deadly chambers of the labyrinth. Another player takes on the role of the Dungeon Lord, summoning monstrous creatures and wielding dark magic.

The adventure is brought to life through an array of cards and dice. As players explore the dungeon, Store Cards describe the rooms and challenges the Hero will face. When a battle erupts or a trap is sprung, Challenge Dice are rolled to see who is victorious.

The adventure culminates in an epic battle between the Hero and the Dungeon Lord with only one player left standing.

The Kickstarter Edition of the game includes 50 additional story cards plus new heroes (Adren the Knight, Cael Oathbringer the Priest, and Rivern the Huntress) and new dungeon lord characters (Norathra the Forsaken, Spider Queen, and Sythean the Devourer).

Specifically this includes:


50 Story Cards
3 Advanced Hero Character Cards
3 Advanced Dungeon Lord Character Cards
23 Creature Cards
27 Hero Skill cards
4 Basic Equipment cards
13 Treasure cards
30 Power cards (Hero)
30 Power cards (Dungeon Lord)
8 Omen cards
42 Final Battle cards
3 Sythean Creature cards
6 Sythean Critical cards
3 Cael Rune cards
12 Cael Rune tokens
4 Norathra Blood Vine tokens
1 Rivern Mark token
1 Blood token
2 Adren Shield tokens
1 Spider Queen Web card
10 Spider Queen Web tokens
173259.name: Fallen: Kickstarter Edition

boardgameintegration: Senet
Senet
173264.description:
Senet is an ancient Egyptian board game.

Senet and Senet-modern are almost looks same but Senet-modern rule is arranged and renewed more speedy, offensive and strategic.

Players move own 5 pieces due to 2 dice number and be up the goal side.

One difference is that players can make opponent's piece out of board and another is Senet-modern pieces are printed different number's dots 1 to 5. Number is score.
The winner is the player who get more score when 3 pieces(both own and opponent) are upped.
173264.name: Senet-modern

173267.name: Donkey Derby
boardgameversion: H P Gibson orange box edition
173267.description:
Party game. In the box there is a roll of twine. This should be cut to 4 equal lengths. One end of the twine is tied to a chair leg and the other end is held by the players. So, the players at the starting line will all be holding a length of twine (about 12 feet long) and they must pull it backwards so that the twine doesn't sag in the middle and the line should be about 18 inches off the floor. Each player now has a 'Donkey' put on to their twine, as near to the players' as possible.

On the word "Off", each player has to jog their twine furiously so that their donkey heads towards their chair. The first to touch the chair leg with their donkey's nose, wins.

The game can be modified to allow young children to play.

173268.name: Malifaux: No Shelter Here – Pandora box set
173268.description:
Let your opponent beat themselves. Literally. You'll be beating people to death with their own arms and watching them suffer the death of a thousand cuts, also self inflicted. Pandora does attract a certain kind of player...

Neverborn Box Set, containing seven 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards and six Upgrades. Will require some preparation and assembly.

173269.name: Aquarium
173269.description:
Aquarium is an underwater city represented on the board by twelve colonies divided into three levels deep. The game action takes place at the end of the XXI century. The match lasts three steps with five rounds in each step. The main goal of each player is to build various elements within the city to score more points.

In his turn a player can move your submarine spending uranium units and after it must intercept a character and do an action. There are five characters in the game: Commander - allows supply the submarine with new crew and also allows the entry of inhabitants in the city. Engineer - builds elements within the colonies. Scientist Alien - provides technology cards. Controller - supplies submarines and the colonies with oxygen. Investor - provides money to players.

In addition, Aquarium has two mini expansions included in the base game: 1 - Special Card characters. 2 - Saboteur, which allows players to hinder the plans of his opponents interrupting the flow of oxygen in certain colonies of the board and causing unexpected penalties!

173270.description:
This game includes both OGRE and its sequel G.E.V., tactical ground combat games set in the not-so-distant future. In 2085 A.D., armored warfare continues - faster and deadlier than ever. Hovercraft, tanks and infantry slug it out with tactical nuclear devices. But the most feared weapon of all needs no human guidance. It's a giant cybernetic tank called the OGRE.

The basic OGRE game gives one player a force of infantry and armor, and a command post he must defend. The other player has only one unit - but it's an OGRE. It's an even match. Advanced games allow solitaire or multi-player action, with OGREs on both sides.

In G.E.V., units from Ogre are carried over, with expanded rules for terrain. A larger map and more ambitious game.
173270.name: Ogre / G.E.V.

173272.name: Advanced Catfolk
173272.description:
From publisher blurb:


Curiosity Has Never Faced These Cats

Whether they be thieves, priests, or dashing swordsmen, catfolk are renowned hunters and admirers of anything novel or strange. They seek out new experiences with zeal and fight their enemies with remarkable agility. Now you can play a catfolk character like never before!

Book of Heroic Races: Advanced Catfolk gives you everything you need to play a catfolk character. This 22-page supplement features:

Racial Traits to play a catfolk, 2 alternate racial traits and 3 new character traits to customize your character for this unique play experience
12 New Character Class Options including 3 new archetypes like the feral rager and the ghost hunter, 8 new rogue talents, and the grymalkin sorcerer bloodline
9 New Feats expanding on your feline heritage
3 New Feline-Themed Spells
2 New Magic Items
3 New Deities, each with a unique cultural perspective that shapes the various catfolk societies
Details on catfolk adventurers as well as suggestions on how to incorporate this race into your world




Be Heroic with This Advanced Race Today!

173273.name: Thursir Giants
173273.description:
From publisher blurb:


Giant smiths and fierce pillagers!

Though one of the least powerful of the known giants, thursir have the greatest impact on humanoid settlements unfortunate enough to exist near their enclaves. Most of the time, thursir work at their vast underground forges, creating armor, weapons, and incredible engines of war—interspersed with great banquets that last for days. But there are also degenerate thursir: clans of terrifying pillagers who will stop in mid-battle to devour chunks of flesh from still-living prey!

Larger Than Life: Thursir is a new 14-page PDF from designer Mike Welham with plenty of material for Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GMs who want to bring original new giants into their game, including:

14 new racial feats including Dwarf Smasher, Forge Hardened and Hammering Cleave
New thursir gear, spells and magic items
Thursir adventure seeds and a CR 10 thursir NPC, Karl Jagendorff - the chief of his clan for close to 40 years
An extensive overview of thursir society, customs, religion and relations with other races




Give your players a titanic new challenge with Larger Than Life: Thursir today!

173274.name: Hananowa
173274.description:
User summary:
ハナノワ (Hananowa) is a game from the Japanese dojin circle Comet. Comet is a community group using board games to bring people together. This game shows their goals in action.

Hananowa is a very quick game based on communication. The players work together to create a story aiming towards the ending on the closure card. But whatever you come up with, you have to tie it to the item cards that you draw throughout the game.

Publisher summary:
このゲームはコミュニケーションを楽しむゲームです。
結末カードに書かれた結末に向かって、みんなでお話を作ります。
ただし、アイテムカードをめくってそこに書かれたものに関係する話をしなくてはなりません。

boardgameintegration: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II
Ghostbusters: The Board Game II
173275.description:
Are you troubled by strange noises in the middle of the night? Do you experience feelings of dread in your basement or attic? Have you or your family ever seen a spook, spectre, or ghost? If the answer is "yes", then don't wait another minute. Pick up the phone and call the professionals!

Ghostbusters: The Board Game is an episodic adventure game for one to four players, who are charged with busting ghosts and sealing gates to the Spirit World. In the game, players choose one of the four Ghostbusters character figures — Peter Venkman, Egon Spengler, Winston Zeddemore and Ray Stantz — then select one of the game's pre-written scenarios, beginning a game session that lasts from 30 minutes to two hours, depending on the chosen scenario(s) and degree of difficulty. Each of the Ghostbusters has unique traits and talents that can assist the entire team, with highly co-operative gameplay. As players gain experience from banishing spirits, the Ghostbusters level up, gaining new abilities that help them take on greater challenges. The team can also hop in the Ecto-1, the Ghostbusters' converted ambulance, to help them quickly move through the city.

Ghostbusters: The Board Game comes with more than forty plastic figures, including the four Ghostbusters, Slimer, Stay Puft Marshmallow Man, Indulnas, and numerous Galloping Ghouls, Gruesome Twosomes and Boogaloo. The game board is created with double-sided modular pieces, increasing the game's replayability for scenarios and customization.
173275.name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game
boardgameexpansion: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Louis Tully's Plazm Phenomenon
Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Peoplebusters Pack
Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Slimer's Sea Fright
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Impossible Mode Ghosts
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Impossible Mode Taxi Drivers
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Kickstarter exclusives
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Mass Hysteria exclusives
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Spectral Ghostbusters
Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Zombie Taxi Drivers
boardgamepodcastepisode: 001: Kickstarting
BGGcon 2015
Ep. 17 – Randomness in Board Games | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 16 : BGGcon 2015 Recap - Codenames - Favor of the Pharoah - Time Stories
GenCon 2015 - Cryptozoic
Ghostbusters Review
MN 0065 Looking Back and Looking Forward
MN 0085 November Gaming - Extra Life & International Game Day
Vox Republica 073: How Not To Be A Board Game Evangelist
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 13!!

173276.name: Link 'N' Launch
173276.description:
Move tiles to get fuel to your rocket and complete dozens of puzzling levels.

Play Missions to reach a target planet, or Puzzle mode to clear the way for your ship
Fun touch controls are easy to learn but hard to master, great for Professor Layton fans
A crafty puzzle game from INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS, makers of Fire Emblem and more

Source: The Publisher Website.

173277.name: Presidents Poker
173277.description:
Did you know that nine U.S. Presidents didn't attend college? Or that six Presidents were born in Ohio, more than any other state? And that one President was stopped for a speeding ticket while riding a horse?

In Presidents Poker, players assemble a hand of President cards with the Presidents that have the most in common, including names, birthplace, college attended, number of children, height, and hair color. Each President card also has a fun fact about that President so that these historical figures really come to life. Chips are included for those who like to bet.

173278.description:
From the publisher:

This fantastic pre-painted premium figure stands several inches tall and towers over all of the other D&D Attack Wing expansion pack miniatures. The perfect encounter for your next adventure, or the perfect ally to your force. The D&D Attack Wing Brass Dragon Premium Figure is a beautiful display piece as well!

The D&D Attack Wing version of the Brass Dragon figure also comes with additional play materials such as Cards, Tokens, Maneuver Dials, and a 6” x 6” D&D Attack Wing base.
173278.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ancient Brass Dragon Premium Figure
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

173279.name: Monopoly: Charlotte Edition
173279.description: The standard board game of Monopoly but re-themed for the great city of Charlotte, NC.

173280.name: 101 Mystical Site Qualities (13th Age)
173280.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create an Enchanted Realm!

101 Mystical Site Qualities gives you – yes, you guessed it – 101 New qualities to help creature a truly mystic location.

From areas where magical items overflow with power, to new areas of dead, wild, unstable, and enhanced magic that can change the nature of an encounter; to areas where only the eastern martial arts hold sway, to evocative locales like Avatar's Landing, Endless Summer, and the Fountain of Grit. 101 Mystical Site Qualities brings a host of new options and wonders for your world.

Wholly compatible with 13th Age 101 Mystical Site Qualities is designed so that you can bring a sense of the evocative and wondrous to your game and provide a benefit or challenge at all levels of play.

Get yours now and make your campaign mystical!

173281.name: Unheil im Schwarzen Keiler
173281.description:
From the back of the book

„Grotho, Garax, Grotho Greifax, Graf von Gratenfels.“

Über diese unvergessene Grußformel stolperten vor 30 Jahren die ersten Heldengruppen in ein dramatisches Abenteuer voller Fallen, geheimer Verliese und jeder Menge Monster. Im verschlafenen Örtchen Gratenfels, wo der tyrannische Herrscher Baldur Greifax düstere Pläne verfolgte, wurde Rollenspielgeschichte geschrieben.

Was liegt also näher, als zum 30. Jubiläum von Das Schwarze Auge zu unser aller Anfängen zurückzukehren? Noch einmal in der „Schänke des Schreckens“ abzusteigen, Leti wiederzutreffen und nachzuschauen, was denn aus den ganzen Leichen geworden ist, die wir damals zurückgelassen haben?

Packt eure alten Charaktere wieder aus und sucht eure allerersten DSA-Würfel! Denn Unheil im Wirtshaus zum Schwarzen Keiler wird von den Alveraniaren exklusiv auf der Ratcon zum Spielen angeboten.

In dem kleinen Wirtshaus am Fuße der Koschberge erwarten euch:

Düstere Geheimnisse und spannende Rätsel
Neue Monster und Ungeheuer
Ein finsteres Verlies und unterirdische Höhlen
Natürlich ganz klassisch mit dem „Plan des Schicksals“ und selbstverständlich wird nach den DSA1-Regeln gespielt!

Mögen die Zwölfe euch gewogen sein!


User description

To celebrate the 30th anniversary of Das Schwarze Auge, Ulisses Spiele published this adventure with the look and rules of an original 1st edition adventure from the 80ies. It is a loose sequel to B01: Im Wirtshaus zum Schwarzen Keiler.

173282.name: Pathways (Issue 47 - Feb 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Cultural Magic Items: Crown of the First and Only
Review: Isles of Plunder: Raid on the Emperor’s Hand
Review: Isles of Plunder: Scourge of the Steaming Isle
The Path Less Traveled #13: Bards Need Evasion
The Secrets of Renegade Archetypes II
Twenty Questions with Robert N. Emerson

173283.name: Equinox Match System Guide
173283.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dark night of a distant future, the shattered remains of Earth drift through the cold void of space. The shadows of the past have been driven away, and the dark clouds at the horizon appear to be man-made. After the Great Netherwar, which resulted in the destruction of Earth, mankind is restless, scattered across the void, bereft of its cradle. The Sol system became the last safe hideout for outcasts both mystic and mundane. Known as Vagrants, they are rebels to the oppressive might of the Consortium—the government ruling over what’s left of Earth and its colonies. True freedom can only be found among the stars, the voices of the galactic underground say. To them, the war isn’t over. It has only just begun.

Welcome to equinox, a future fantasy game of stunning action, frightening intrigue, and mystical powers! In this game, you ride hybrid ships through the astral space connecting planets and galaxies and wield awesome mystic powers and nethertech artifacts! Take on the role of a restless wanderer—someone living on the fringes of galactic society, scraping by in a war-torn universe, maybe even stealing other people‘s stuff. Whether a misfit, scoundrel, mercenary, pirate, idealist, explorer, or just someone who walked away from his home in search of adventure: you are part of the galactic underground. Fight the nightmares that invaded the universe, start a revolution against the fascistic and corrupt Consortium government, and explore space beyond the Veil..

The Equinox Match System Guide is a roleplaying game of stunning action, frightening intrigue, and mystical powers! Designed for larger-than-life characters with special and extremely powerful abilities, this book provides all the tools needed for adventures in a war-ravaged dark future. The Equinox Setting Guide is required to use this book.

173284.name: Lair of the Wrathmaster (Savage Worlds)
173284.description:
From publisher blurb:

A savage group of teenaged villains is raiding a long abandoned base of a retired supervillain.

Can your heroes stop them before they unleash a reign a terror with the super-science weapons they'll find there?

Lair of the Wrathmaster is a short, fun, fast-playing scenario that is ideal for a quick evening's entertainment or to drop as a set-piece into a longer adventure.

This adventure takes place in Stark City - but can be used in any setting with little or no adaptation.

This product requires the use of Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion (2nd Ed)

173286.name: Intergalactic Fight Club
173286.description:
Let's bring the past and the future to the present with this awesome fighting card and dice game. Come join the action packed, fast paced, imaginary galaxy described as Street Fighter meets pro wrestling! Welcome to the IFC!

This game takes elements of various games and molded its own to create what is now the IFC. It's a simple fight game that has no crazy charts, move cards or other wacky add ons...just simple cards with vibrant characters, dice and your imagination.

173287.name: Redshirts 2: Leprechaun's Revenge
173287.description:
Leprechaun's Revenge is an expansion for what is simply the bestest and most funnest card game in the world, Redshirts.

Redshirts is a fast paced screw-your-buddies style card game for 2 to 6 players. Technically you can play with more, if you have extra cards from expansion sets.

Redshirts is a card game set in a universe similar to, but legally distinct from, many sci-fi franchises. The goal is to be the first player to run out of crewmen because everyone knows the captains of boring voyages don't get promotions. You do this by sending them on missions they are not trained for, taking away vital equipment at the last second, and occasionally, just shooting them in the back and shoving them out an airlock.

Redshirts 2: Leprechaun's Revenge is an expansion, offering a new set of cards, featuring the evil protagonist, Leprechaun. (Don't worry, there's lots of other stuff in there too.)

173290.name: Slideways
boardgamepodcastepisode: 11 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Travel Games
173290.description: Get ready to flip out with this flip 'n slide game of tic-tac-toe! Slideways is a fast-paced puzzle game of logic and skill that raises the bar on fun as players try to outwit their opponents. Move your bar on the board or flip colors to get four in a row. Is it as easy as it seems?

173291.name: Spit It Out!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 008 – T.I.M.E Stories vs Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
173291.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Think fast! Spit It Out! is the fun, fast-paced party game in which you have to retrain your brain to give the WRONG answer to easy questions — but sometimes you have to give the RIGHT answers, too, and you have just thirty seconds to spit it out! Rewire your brain to victory in this hilarious game where wrong is right.

173292.name: Cup-A-Cup
173292.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It's all cup for grabs! Cup-A-Cup is a game of quick thinking and fast hands, a race to catch the cups first! Roll the dice, quickly identify the missing colored shape, then swipe the matching cup off the table. But be careful! No cup is safe — they're all up for grabs! The first player to collect three cups wins!

173293.name: Carnival Games Monkey See Monkey Do
173293.description:
Game Cover

It's midway magic as you leap into the air and Rocket to Mars, catch coins careening down Gold Rush Mountain and twist your body in Crash-Test Dummy. Play classics like Alley Ball, Strength Test, Wheel of Chance and more!

Speak to Wodin the Wizard to learn your future and hear a riddle or two!

With pets, prizes, and surprises galore, a family-friendly fun fest is in store.

boardgameintegration: DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman
DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash

173294.description:
Game description from the publisher:

DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

In this game, each player fields one of the superhero teams, with each hero — Batman, Wonder Woman, Hal Jordan, Mogo, Superboy Prime, Sinestro and more — being represented by custom-tooled dice; each team must be composed of 15 dice, and a player can "purchase" dice only from his team. Each hero also has one or more character reference cards, which show the special abilities for the characters based on the die rolls. Different versions of these cards are available in booster packs, allowing for more customization of your team. Players use these dice to collect energy, recruit new heroes, and battle head-to-head. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards to the game, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase these cards. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light debuts both the Teen Titans and new Lantern Corps never before seen in Dice Masters! With gameplay that supports two players in epic dice battles, DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light lets players build their own team of heroes or villains!
173294.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light

173295.description:
Take your battles to the stars with X-Wing™ Playmats, available via Fantasy Flight Games’ In-House Manufacturing! Each X-Wing Playmat takes the form of an easily portable, 3’ by 3’ neoprene playmat, complete with a slip-resistant bottom that helps to ensure your valuable miniatures stay safe during your space battles. Whether you field a squadron for the Rebel Alliance, the Imperial Navy, or the Scum and Villainy of the galaxy, you’ll find a cinematic setting for your ship-to-ship battles in the X-Wing Playmats.

The Starfield Playmat displays a dramatic view of the galaxy’s stars, placing your fast-paced dogfight anywhere in the Star Wars™ universe. This playmat’s minimalist design makes it especially suitable for tournament play, but it ultimately offers a stylish background for tournament or casual games.
boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

Take your battles to the stars with X-Wing Playmats, available via Fantasy Flight Games’ In-House Manufacturing! Each X-Wing Playmat takes the form of an easily portable, 3’ by 3’ neoprene playmat, complete with a slip-resistant bottom that helps to ensure your valuable miniatures stay safe during your space battles. Whether you field a squadron for the Rebel Alliance, the Imperial Navy, or the Scum and Villainy of the galaxy, you’ll find a cinematic setting for your ship-to-ship battles in the X-Wing Playmats.

The Death Star Assault Playmat takes your dogfight straight to the climax of Star Wars: A New Hope. You can reenact the Alliance’s desperate trench run, or tell your own stories set against the backdrop of the Empire’s ultimate weapon. Whether you seek to break the Empire’s power, or establish dominion over the galaxy, this playmat will serve you well.

173300.description:
Game Cover

Race Hard in Super Modified Pick Ups

20 Tough Tracks - master challenging tracks

Truck Upgrades - suspension, engine, tires, and body
Rugged Handling - ready for the toughest conditions

173301.name: Grand Theft Auto The Trilogy
173301.description:
Game Cover

One of the most popular and critically acclaimed franchises in entertainment history. The original Grand Theft Auto Trilogy now available in a limited edition PlayStation 2 System Box Set.

173302.description:
News@11 is a recursive storytelling game in which the players are anchors at a news desk or on assignment in a world going weird. The game is played in three rounds — Morning News, News at Noon and Evening Edition — in which the players take turns making up news stories, using elements from the previous rounds, as well as bringing new items in. They have to think on their feet and adapt their news stories to different newscaster roles.

Each round, the players need to adapt the story elements they are given to the news segment they have been assigned. Being assigned a segment helps players build a starting story and in future rounds causes stories to blend and change in interesting ways.

The three recursive rounds are at the core of the experience. Seeing the same news item start out as a relatively simple Home and Beauty segment, then in Sportsball a bit more odd and unbelievable, and finally as a Political where the hilarious chaos peaks adds to the zany nature of the recursion.
173302.name: News@11

Due to differences in print sheets, we had a bunch of extra blank cards during the last print run. And so we had some more cards created, and we are offering those to you first. These will normally only be available directly from us at conventions, and there are a very limited amount. This set doesn't have a name or a theme, but we do make fun of Warhammer 40k a lot.

173306.name: Net the Fox
173306.description:
A game of skill and chance for two!

FROM THE GAME BOX:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: For the hunter to capture the fox.

PIECES NEEDED TO PLAY : Two different colored pegs and 1 pair of dice. The Fox makes the first move. Both he and the Hunter can only move along the lines. Both Fox and Hunter alternate turns moving only one space at a time. The Hunter tries to force the Fox into a position where the Hunter's next move would be into the same hole the Fox is in. When the Hunter reaches this position he rolls the dice. If he rolls an even number, he has netted the Fox. If he rolls an odd number the Fox may take two moves and thus gets away. The game continues until the Hunter again corners the Fox. At this time the Hunter again rolls the dice. If an even number is rolled the Hunter wins, but if an odd number is rolled the Fox has eluded the Hunter for the second time, and the Fox is the winner.

boardgamecompilation: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Kickstarter exclusives

173310.name: My Metropolis
173310.description:
You and your friends are business moguls and there is a new plot of land in the city that is ripe for building! You want to build the most floors, have the tallest sky scrapers, and screw over your opponents. Each tunr you take your fortune into your own hands by choosing more or less risky bets on what numbers will be rolled and what resources to collect.

Corporate America was built on ruthless tactics and stock photography. The dark humor and art reinforces this point with leadership cards that players strategically utilize to gain ground on their opponents.

My Metropolis is a 3-4 player worker game that features worker placement and resource collection. Inspired by Settlers of Catan and Small World, My Metropolis is a fast paced and cut throat gaming experience with varied strategy and unique artwork.

173317.name: Fork Parker's Holiday Profit Hike
173317.description:
User Summary

Control Fork Parker in his quest to raise company profits in this free to play 2D side scroller. This is done by scaling a dangerous mountain full of spikes and enemies, collecting money as you climb, and losing money whenever you die, until you reach the summit. Run, jump, bounce off of enemies, and attach ropes to two hard surfaces to create pulley lines to slide on in order to scale the mountain.

173318.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Faith and Fear
173318.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Gomorra needs a revival! After the disastrous Election Day, Gomorra seems like a town devoid of mercy or grace, but there are some devoted to the work of the divine. Bringing blessings and simple compassion, these souls seek not only to raise up the meek, but drive out those who would destroy. But can the same be said of the new mayor?

Faith and Fear is the first Pinebox set for Doomtown: Reloaded and introduces the new Blessed dudes and their miracles — but of course other forces are always at work, and you'll find many new cards for all your favorite factions, including four entirely new outfit cards!

Lost Legacy: Fourth Chronicle – The Werewolf & Undying Heart

173319.description:
In the distant past, a starship from a faraway world appeared in the sky. Damaged in battle, the craft broke apart and traced lines of fire across the horizon. These falling stars crashed to the surface, and in the ages to come, became enshrined in legends as the Lost Legacy. Discover where the Lost Legacy can be found and win the game!

Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle contains two sets of game cards: Vorpal Sword and Whitegold Spire. Each set can be played independently or mixed together with other sets to create a unique custom set.

As for how to play, Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: Throughout gameplay you're trying to eliminate other players or uncover the location of the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. When someone discovers the Lost Legacy, the game ends, everyone tallies the value of the cards they've played and the card left in hand, and whoever has the highest total wins.



By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.
173319.name: Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle – Vorpal Sword & Whitegold Spire

173320.name: Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem – Luck of the Irish Expansion

Its current status is now assumed to be 'cancelled' after a GF9 member on their message boards stated there was no intention to release another expansion for SoA.

boardgameaccessory: Firefly: The Game
