boardgameimplementation: Character Quest: Heroes – Goblin Raiders Adventure
boardgameintegration: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard
Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3: Haunted Oak
Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard
Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3: Haunted Oak
173322.description:
In CQ:Heroes, up to 4 players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard from Game Pack #1 to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers from Game Pack #2, Savage Beasts, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

The heroes from Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts feature Pet heroes that can be controlled by the Beastmaster skill.

Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts includes the Adventure Deck: Desert Temple which features all new cards including a new card type: Raid Boss. These encounters are much tougher than normal encounters and are placed in the location area when revealed.
The new objective in Desert Temple is to defeat 3 of these Raid Bosses to open up the Throne Room. This triggers the final battle where all players make last party of heroes to battle each other for the room's treasures.

GAME FEATURES:

Simple and engaging: Although it's simple to learn and play, turns can become quite involved with all of the hero abilities and how you combo them during your turn.

Everyone plays to the end: No one is eliminated during the game and all players count their victory points at the end.

Quick flow of play: Because you draw up your hand at the end of your turn, you are then able to plan your next turn while others are taking theirs.

Accessible: Only 1 deck is needed for up to 4 players. Extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share.

Easy to collect: No mystery packs. Each deck has all the cards you need to play.

Fast: The game sets up in less than a minute and plays in about 10-20 minutes.

HOW TO PLAY:

Starting with the first player, each player performs the following 4 actions in order:

ATTACK: Attack 1 encounter OR skip your attack to add one additional Hero to your Tavern on the next step
TAVERN: Place 1 hero in your Tavern (2 if you skipped your attack)
DRAW: Draw your hand back up to 5 cards
REFRESH: Draw and add 1 new Adventure card to the dungeon hall
173322.name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts
boardgameexpansion: Character Quest: Desert Warrior's Hero Set

173323.name: Character Quest: Heroes – Goblin Raiders Adventure
boardgameimplementation: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard
Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts
173323.description:
Goblin Raiders Adventure intro: The nearby farms are being captured and pillaged! Lead by a Goblin Brute that must be defeated. Player's take turns trying to free Wheat Field locations before Goblin Torchers show up and pillage them. Once the fields have been rescued (or burned), players will then be able to try and defeat the Goblin Brute before time runs out!

A full 50 card hero deck. It has a few heroes from Game Pack #1, a few from Game Pack #2 and a couple heroes from a future Game Pack (sneak peak of the Storm Shaman, Half-Giant Warrior, and Templar)

The full 26 card Goblin Raiders Adventure deck is a spin off of the Goblin Keep Adventure but it also includes a few new cards made just for this demo (mostly to help with the new objective of stopping the goblins from raiding nearby farmlands!)

This introductory set does not use the final art from either Game Pack #1 or #2. The cards also reference 'Raid', this simply means a fight or battle.

A link for downloading this game can be found on the Kickstarter campaign page for Character Quest: Heroes (Tavern Edition).

173325.description:
King's Valley Labyrinth is a new extension game of original King's Valley.

Board size is enlarged to 7x7 square grid and 4 pillar stone spaces are added.

As in the original game the simplicity of the game stems from the fact that the movement of all the pieces is the same.
All pieces move horizontally or vertically or diagonally.
But when a piece is moved it must continue its movement until, and only until, it reaches a vacant square adjacent to (alongside) either the edge of the board or another piece or pillar stone.
The game is decided when one player moves the King piece to the center square--the King's Valley--thus winning the game.
173325.name: King's Valley Labyrinth

173328.name: Zuqi
173328.description:
Zuqi is a game of intense strategy in which players try to achieve the classic goal of getting four pieces in a row or occupy all four corners at once, but there's a twist. Each piece in your arsenal has unique movement abilities, capture abilities, and other powers at their disposal, and you may only bring 5 out of 8 of them to every game, so each game will play out very differently.

With unique rules that keep the game balanced and fair from beginning to end, every game is intense, and even if you're winning in one moment, the tide can quickly turn. Compete with your opponent for supremacy on the battlefield in a mental tug of war. You take one piece from him, he places another. He takes one from you, you place another. Eventually something has to give, and it shall. This is a game of strategy and skill and only the strong shall prevail.

173329.name: Trzciano 1629
173329.description:
Game covers series of three battles - Trzciana, Pułkowice and Straszewo fought between polish and imperial forces against army of Sweden, led by the Gustav II Adolf.

Game was published in the 39 issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

173330.name: The Brain Trust
173330.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE BRAIN TRUST!!

Formed together by the mysterious Mentor, The Brain Trust is a team of sinister psionicists bent on using their powers for villainy! Working from their secret headquarters, they're targeting your campaign city and its so-called protectors next. Can your heroes stop them? Or will they fall to their malicious minds?

173331.name: Lady Faro
173331.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet LADY FARO!!

Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! Self-serving queen of an underworld drug cartel and leading lady of one of the largest casinos in all of Canada, Lady Faro operates both in the light and in the shadows. Although, she's not unwilling to get directly involved, if the need arises. The probabilities are endless with this one... and she lives to be a pain the @$$ for Canadian authorities and, of course, Les Supérieurs.

173332.name: The Changeling
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
173332.description:
From publisher blurb:

You never had a chance at a normal life. It was all set from the beginning. It's not that you have a great destiny or anything like that. It's not like your parents were from some cult or something. You didn't make any deals under the moon.You weren't stalked by a werewolf or vampire.

No, the only problem you had was that you were adopted...and you were never human. You just never knew that until puberty hit and you started changing.

You don't know what you are, but you know it brings trouble. So if trouble is going to find you, you might as well be prepared to put trouble down. And maybe someday you'll find a way to fix yourself and be a normal person again.

Play as the reluctant inhuman suffering from a mystery heritage.

173333.description:
From the publisher:

D&D Attack Wing Template Sets include several high quality semi-transparent movement templates with laser-etched information on each element for use with D&D Attack Wing.

Each D&D Attack Wing Template Set includes 1 Range Ruler, 3 turn movement templates, 4 bank movement templates, and 6 straight movement templates crafted from high quality semi-rigid transparent plastic.
boardgameaccessory: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing
173333.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Template Set

173334.name: Venture Hold: A Dungeon Adventure
173334.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Awaits… Beyond the Iron Gates…

Venture Hold: A Dungeonteller Adventure for Heroes with 10–14 Luck

Includes 9 amazing hand-drawn iso dungeon and town maps by Doug Anderson

The gates to Venture Hold are locked to keep unlicensed adventurers out… and undead horrors in. A license to loot from the local town council can cost you an arm and a leg, sometimes only figuratively. For novice adventurers in the town of Lastward, your career path begins as a hired hand for one of the big adventurers in town, who are mini-celebrities in their own right…

This is a big adventure module designed for use with the Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG. You need to buy the Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG and the Dungeonteller Monster Book in order to play, unless you want to adapt the monsters and NPCs to other rules systems. Using Dungeonteller, about 6 –10 game sessions would be needed to explore the dungeon, meaning that heroes would gain 6–10 Luck, 3–5 action dice, and 1 new power in the course of play.

The adventure is woven with a number of story arcs and missions that heroes can chose to follow or ignore as they like. You can play it as a linear stop-the-bad-guys quest game or just go dungeon-crawling. At the bottom of the dungeon, there are possibilities for further play (if you’re willing to develop them), or the heroes can just return to the surface.

A town to explore with over a dozen locations described
Eight dungeon levels, with over 100 keyed locations
New Dungeonteller monsters and adversaries
Dozens of statted NPCs

173335.name: Open Combat
173335.description:
From the publisher's website:

Create the heroes, adventures and battles of your imagination.

The Open Combat tabletop miniature wargame skirmish rules are suitable for any pre-gunpowder historical period or fantasy setting.

Use any miniatures & terrain you have
Only a small area required (24"x24")
Suitable for pre-gunpowder historical periods and fantasy settings
Customize the characteristics of your fighters, ‘stat’ them any way you like.
Fast setup and play time (30-40mins)
Open Combat puts you in command of a warband of fighters led by their charismatic (or frightening) leader as they match themselves against their foes.

Who the combatants are and what they are fighting about is down to you, your miniature collection and what you have the 'itch' to play.
The 50 page PDF includes rules for building and customizing your warbands along with a range of weapons, skills & abilities (including Influence abilities where your warriors can make psychological attacks against the enemy).

You'll find rules for movement, combat, terrain and additional rules for hiding, climbing and jumping.

Scenarios include 'Open Combat' with three optional deployments including 'confrontation' where your warbands could begin the game intermingled even before the fighting starts! Additional scenarios set the warbands the task of capturing prey or discovering prizes hidden on the battlefield.

Two roster sheet approaches are included: A 'single page' for players that like all of the information in one place; A sheet of character cards for players that like to have separate information for each model.

Also included are guide to creating your first profile, Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) and a Quick Reference Sheet.

173336.name: Million Club
173336.description:
London 1880 — the industrial revolution has brutally changed the face of the world. Resources, industries, transportation, and new empires are being raised from the smoke of coal and fumes of machines. You have come to enter the prestigious million club, a very closed circle of barons of finance and industry.
Investments, opportunities, intrigue — it's all up to you what you'll make in this new world...

Million Club is all about confrontation, with only a single winner standing tall in the end.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
173337.description:
Seven daring adventurers have trespassed in a dragon's lair, initially seeking its treasure but now just trying to make it out alive as the dragon has woken and is chasing them through its labyrinth. The sooner that a dragon captures an adventurer, the fewer points it's worth at the end of the round — and should an adventurer actually manage to escape, many points in treasure await.

In Drachenhort, players don't represent these adventurers themselves, but rather secretly back a trio of these adventurers. Each turn, the active player rolls a die and moves one of the adventurers further away from the dragon. After all of the adventurers have moved once, all of them are available for movement once again. Don't be too obvious about which adventurers you support, though, for others will drop traps in their path or otherwise hobble them to ensure that they become dragon food first.

At the end of a round, players score points based on how far their adventurers traveled, and after two rounds the player with the most points wins.
173337.name: Drachenhort
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #112 - Piterpanes de 40

173338.name: Pollen
173338.description: Pollen has something to do with bees...and pollen. That's all we've got right now.

173339.name: Dead or Alive
173339.description:
It's not easy keeping a family close, especially when everyone can shift between their DEAD and ALIVE states at will.

In this quirky take on the fundamentals of game theory, players need to agree to meet in the land of the dead or the land of the living. If they cannot, they lose. If they can, they win. The twist is - if 1 family member is able to betray the rest, they win big, and the others lose big.

Collaborate, debate, investigate... be the one who discards all their cards first by cheating your way between the land of the dead and the land of the living.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
173341.description: This 2-3 player version of Loopin' Louie is re-themed with the Star Wars license. Chewbacca in the Millenium Falcon is tasked with knocking out the other players' stormtroopers. When only one player has stormtroopers left, that player wins.
173341.name: Loopin' Chewie
boardgameaccessory: Loopin' Louie: Loopomator

173342.name: Weapon Mastery: Shang Gou
173342.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting Weapon Mastery: Shang Gou! a series of 4 all-new weapon style feats for mastering the exotic "hook sword."

173343.name: Trains: Modern
173343.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a set of 28, 8 x10 inch Battlemaps of Modern Trains, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.
Please note, these were made more for playability that accuracy of scale.

“If this ICBM gets to the launch site and is armed with a biological, chemical or nuclear warhead, millions may be at risk. Sneak on to the train, ride to the launch site, and then destroy both the missile and the launcher before they can arm the ICBM.”

Trains and Subways Modern includes twenty-eight pages of the interiors of trains and subway cars with a gravel and plains exterior for above ground train pages and a walkway platform to step down to the subway cars for underground subway pages.

Trains and Subways Modern is intended for modern or near future science fiction games. For older steam engine trains, use our Trains Wild West product instead.

Adventure hook for use with this product:

Missile Smuggling: For this adventure, it is suggested the group play as spies or Special Forces for the military. The government has been alerted to an enemy threat. A train is carrying an ICBM from a storage silo to an unknown launch site. The government fears that the ICBM is going to be armed with a biological, chemical, or nuclear threat once it reaches the launch site. The government or military orders the group to sneak onto this train and get to the launch site. After arrival at the launch site, the group is to destroy the launching apparatus and the missile. But they don’t stop at a location, but instead find themselves running parallel with another train. The enemy has manufactured a curious new weapon, a massive train rocket launcher intended to be used as a mobile missile firing platform. The enemy attempts to move the ICBM from the first train to the rocket launcher train with a crane on a train car, arm it, and then launch it with the train rocket launcher. The group has to blow up the second train while dealing with enemy forces on the train trying to stop them. (Note that this set has a missile carrying train car but not a crane or rocket launcher train car).

173344.description: Booze Barons is a quick, team-based hidden identity and deduction game set during U.S. Prohibition where you are bootlegging a particular type of booze and secretly delivering it to speakeasies all over the city. Each time you make a delivery, you get a coin, but also reveal information about the type of booze you are bootlegging. Expose bootleggers of opposing mobs and help those who are in your mob since the mob with the most coins at the end wins!
173344.name: Booze Barons

173345.name: Hints
173345.description:
The only real gestures game.

"Hints" is a game in which you can not be speak. You must make word or words combination clear to the rest of your team without speaking it. The categories 'saying', 'film', 'TV', 'songs', 'books' and 'radio' have fixed gestures. Your teammates have 60 seconds to guess what you gestures mean.

173346.description:
In many ways 7 Wonders Duel resembles its parent game 7 Wonders as over three ages players acquire cards that provide resources or advance their military or scientific development in order to develop a civilization and complete wonders.

What's different about 7 Wonders Duel is that, as the title suggests, the game is solely for two players, with the players not drafting cards simultaneously from hands of cards, but from a display of face-down and face-up cards arranged at the start of a round. A player can take a card only if it's not covered by any others, so timing comes into play as well as bonus moves that allow you to take a second card immediately. As in the original game, each card that you acquire can be built, discarded for coins, or used to construct a wonder.

Each player starts with four wonder cards, and the construction of a wonder provides its owner with a special ability. Only seven wonders can be built, though, so one player will end up short.

Players can purchase resources at any time from the bank, or they can gain cards during the game that provide them with resources for future building; as you acquire resources, the cost for those particular resources increases for your opponent, representing your dominance in this area.

A player can win 7 Wonders Duel in one of three ways: each time you acquire a military card, you advance the military marker toward your opponent's capital, giving you a bonus at certain positions; if you reach the opponent's capital, you win the game immediately; similarly, if you acquire any six of seven different scientific symbols, you achieve scientific dominance and win immediately; if none of these situations occurs, then the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
173346.name: 7 Wonders Duel

173347.description:
Mythic Heroes is a light strategy game, where each player controls a famed hero of Greek Mythology. Players are vying for the title of Greatest of the ancient heroes. Win by finding and defeating mythical creatures or by battling your fellow heroes.

Each player uses the cards in their hand to perform actions on their turn to gain an advantage or trip up the competition. All the while, the Gods of Mt. Olympus will appear at random to mix up the game play.
173347.name: Mythic Heroes

173348.name: Sobriety Test
173348.description: Can you recite "Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star" backward? Can you name all twelve signs of the zodiac while hammered out of your mind? Can you do a curtsy while balancing a ball on your fist? Influenced by the tests issued to those who may have had tee many martoonies, Sobriety Test is a hilarious and raucous game that will have friends reeling just to prove they're totally "with it." This game will challenge memory, speech, and composure, and that's with or without drinking!

173349.name: Music Rocks
173349.description:
Music Rocks is a game of Music. Divide into teams or play one on one and beat each other in finding hit songs. It’s free for songbirds to sing the songs and for musicians to add optional instruments.

The symbols on the dice represent the most popular words in hit songs from 1890 to date. Roll the dice and try to think of a song lyric with the help of the symbols.
Example: The symbol of the Sun may make you think of Soundgarden's "Black Hole Sun". Or why not "Summertime, and the living is easy"? But remember, you must always be able to explain it afterwards.

The game has one basic game play and many suggested alternative rules.

173350.name: Elfenbanner
173350.description:
From the back of the book:
Das Elfenbanner, der einzige magische Gegenstand, der das Konigreich noch rettn konnte, ist zu Asche verbrannt

English translation:
The elves banner, the only magical relic that could save the Kingdom now is burned to ashes

173351.name: Pony express
173351.description: Pony Express is a game for the younger audience. Task is to deliver mail on specified places as soon as possible. Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to deliver as many mails. Each mail brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

173352.name: Into the Village: Map 1
173352.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173353.name: Marketplaces J-L
173353.description:
From publisher blurb:

Herein we provide 3 new shop locations that can be used in any fantasy setting. Each is distinctive and different from a standard shop. They also include several adventure ideas and a table inspired by the location. This article showcases a carpenter, a bakery and a goldsmith. These are good for several nights of adventure or as an interesting location the characters are passing through.

173354.name: AudioMemory Game
173354.description:
Game for children aged 3-8 years, learning foreign language (English, German or Spanish).

The educational aim of the game is to develop the sense of hearing (less used at school than the sense of sight) and to memorise the correct pronunciation of the foreign vocabulary.
Square cards have got pictures on one side and QR codes at the back. You set up them like in classic memory, hiding pictures. Using a special application for mobile devices (Android or iOS), produced by publisher, you scan QR codes of two cards of your choice. You will hear two recordings. If they are the same, you’ve just found the pair. Take these cards and look at the pictures to check if you understand the meaning of the foreign words. If recordings are different, it’s not a pair so it’s a next player turn.

The game is now available only in the print-and-play version (in the teacher’s pack "Memo The Dragon", www.memothedragon.pl). Mobile apps are available for free.

173355.name: Fenomena
173355.description:
From the RPG website:
In Fenomena vi calerete nei panni degli Emissari de La Struttura, una misteriosa organizzazione volta a salvare la realtà dall'Omega, una perturbazione soprannaturale in grado di sovvertire l'ordine delle cose.

English translation:
In Fenomena you will will be one of the Emissaries of The Structure, a mysterious organization devoted to save reality from Omega, a supernatural perutbation able to subvert the order of things.

comment
this is a plastic suitcase that contains three modules, dice, sheets

173357.name: 7 Wonders: Art Pack
boardgameaccessory: 7 Wonders
173357.description:
The 7 Wonders: Art Pack consists of the original wonder boards from the 7 Wonders board game, but with new art from well-known game artists.

The 7 Wonders: Art Pack is part of an organized play pack created by publisher Repos Production for use by brick-and-mortar retailers to encourage participation in 7 Wonders tournaments within their stores. Each player who participates in such a tournament receives at random one of the wonder boards from the 7 Wonders: Art Pack while the winner of the tournament receives all seven wonders.


From the back cover:

The Art Pack is an exclusive edition recreating the 7 wonders player boards from the base game. In fact, seven brilliant artists from the world of gaming have placed their talents in the service of 7 Wonders to give to you their artistic visions of the founding wonders.

user comment
The short description is given in 8 languages. No rules are provided (you're supposed to have a box of 7 Wonders to use the Art Pack).


Artist by Wonder

Halikarnassós - Mathieu Leyssenne
Alexandria - Miguel Coimbra
Éphesos - Pierô
Rhódos - Jean-Baptiste 'Djib' Reynaud
Olympía - Dimitri Chappuis
Babylon - Xavier Gueniffey Durin (aka Naïade)
Gizah - Vincent Dutrait

173358.name: Wild Cards
173358.description:
sWild Cards are a collection of rules for games that utilize a deck of 52 playing cards. Each card contains the rules for a unique game made up by Nick Pace. I have played these a few times at parties and with family after being challenged to make up some good social games. Think of these as a replacement for the useless joker cards that accompany every box of playing cards.

The artwork is all done by my friend JP, which is based upon a concept sketch I give him. He does a great job with the cartoon graphics since these games are meant for people of ages 8+. Great for family outings, waits at the airport, and parties.

173359.name: Bank Vault
173359.description:
A shipment of rare gold bullion coins are being transported to your bank for safe overnight keeping.

As employees of the bank, you and your 'team' have special access to the outside of the vault where the coins are being stored. Each of your team has knowledge of a small part of the combination.

But plans have changed and betrayal is immenent, your 'friends' aren't so quick to give up their information. And an alarm has been tripped, and you all have 5 minutes to get the coins and get out...

In Bank Vault you have 5 minutes to figure out the code to the vault. The first person to determine the full code is the winner. The code is a series of four digits, each of a different color.

Each person at the table knows one of the numbers, and may be willing to share information via quid pro quo. Although you must realize that:


one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding numbers
one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding colors
and everyone else is telling the truth

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game

rpgitemversion: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Issue #1 - Demonboard

User summary:

The first issue of Lair of Sword & Sorcery goes over how one can create their own demonboard. A simple and cost effective way towards creating your own 3D battle map.

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game

The second issue of Lair of Sword & Sorcery covers all things combat.
