boardgamecompilation: King of New York Promo Cards
173363.description: King of New York: Hibernation is a promotional Keep card for King of New York. You are forbidden from buying this card in Manhattan (too noisy!). It prevents you from taking damage, but the only rolls you can use are ♥ and ⌁ — using anything else wakes you from hibernation.
173363.name: King of New York: Hibernation

173364.name: Graal (Issue 4 - Feb 1988)
rpgissuearticle: Capitaine Cosmos terrible partie de cache-cache
La guerre en plomb: Magiciens & Illusioninistes
La quête du Graal: L'œuf pourpre
La quête du Graal: La cités des Princes-Brigands
La quête du Graal: Le temple des dix-mille fumées
Mini Campagne: La quête du Graal
Moscow 1941: l'ennemi était à leur portée
Profession de foi: la création de règles
Warhammer in English or Warhammer en Français
173364.description:
(translated) From the cover:


Cthulhu, Runequest, Stormbringer: a mini campaign.
Cry Havoc & co.
RuneQuest: erratas.

173366.name: Dragon Radieux (Special Issue 3 - Dec 1989)
173366.description:
(translated) From the cover:


Call of Cthulhu, Dungeon & Dragons, Rêve de Dragon, Stormbringer, Hurlements...
Roleplaying Games "Special adventures"
11 adventures and a poster

173367.name: Doug, Doug, Goose, Caboose
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 1 - Gateway Games And Jon Gilmour
173367.description:
Doug, Doug, Goose, Caboose is a quick party game inspired by the children's playground game "Duck, Duck, Goose". The game supports 3-8 players, and plays in about 10 minutes.

The dealer shuffles the deck of cards (one per player in the game), and deals one, in turn, to each player, calling out the card each time. Once both the "Goose" and "Caboose" cards are in play, these player race to call out the other players names, going clockwise around the table. The winner scores a point. The cards are shuffled and the game continues until someone scores three points.

But wait! There's more! The "Goose" and "Caboose" players can get tripped up and have to start over if they don't say the names right, or if they don't call the other racing player "Doug". Everyone else is in charge with keeping the racing players honest.

173368.name: Ganymede
173368.description:
Materials
8x8 checkerboard
64 Othello disks

Play
Board starts out empty.
One player plays black the other white.
Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Place a friendly color disk in an empty space that is not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disk (diagonally adjacent is fine) and

2) Move another friendly color disk already on the board any distance in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally, without jumping over other disks and ending the move in an empty space. The last disk moved must not be orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disks (diagonally adjacent is fine) or

3) Pass

The game ends when players pass consecutively.

Object
The player with the largest connected group of orthogonally adjacent disks, in his color, wins.

173369.description:
Captain’s Quarters is a tile rummy game that replaces colored numbers with the maritime signal flag alphabet. The name Captain’s Quarters is a reference to the nautical theme but also a pun. Each of the 26 flags in the alphabet are divided into quarters creating 104 graphic tiles. Like other tile rummy games, the tiles are used to make groups that can be rearranged to create new groups; however, you will find out quickly the quartered flags add a revolutionary type of gameplay.

The goal is to be the first player to play all of his or her tiles after assembling at least two nautical signal flags correctly.

Captain’s Quarters is a fresh new addition to the world of rummy and mahjong both thematically and mechanically.
173369.name: Captain's Quarters

173370.name: Europa
173370.description:
Europa is a Reversi variant.

Materials
8x8 checkerboard
64 Othello disks

Play
Board starts out empty.

One player plays black the other white.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

The game is played in two phases.

In the first phase on a turn, you must,

1) Place a friendly color disk in an empty space that is not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disk (diagonally adjacent is fine) or

2) Pass.

The game enters the second phase after players pass consecutively.

So from now on, on a turn, either,

1) Place a disk of your color on an empty space or

2) Place a disk on an empty space so that it and another like color disk already on the board enclose a line of one or more
disks of your opponent. Then flip the disks to your color. A line of enclosed disks may run horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

The game ends when the board is full.

Object
The player with the most disks in his color on the board wins.

173371.description:
From the back of the box:
Children learn about the connections between objects and develop language and logic skills. This game is played with jumbo-sized, self-correcting cards. What goes with the chair? That's easy - it's the table! If you're not sure, just see if the two puzzle pieces fit together. Rules for 4 different games are included.
173371.name: Can You Match It?

173372.name: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Sharpshooter vs. Bruiser
boardgameintegration: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game
Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Scout vs. Grenadier
Hawken: Real-Time Card Game
Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Scout vs. Grenadier
173372.description: Based on the HAWKEN Online Video Game. Hawken fans and giant Mech fans alike will love the dynamic play experience. Real-time, but pausable gameplay makes the action fast, furious? and fair! Play cards quickly and when ready, grab the FIRE button! Both players pause and resolve the cards in play. Last mech standing wins. Includes decks for Sharpshooter and Bruiser Mechs. Compatible with other Hawken Real-Time Card Game sets. A real-time card game for 2 players, ages 15+, with easy to learn rules, and a 30 minute playing time.

173373.name: Quotes & Verses
173373.description:
Quotes & Verses (Q&V) is fun! It can liven up your connect groups, prayer meetings and even social gatherings.

Let Q&V be the instrument to deepen friendships, old and new. Share your life experiences with Q&V and be able inspire, give hope, or just simply vent your burdens.

With Q&V, you’ll be surprised at what others could say about your situation. Everyone’s perspective counts.

Q&V is a game about life, a tool for reaching out and touching others. It plays 2-7 players and about 10 minutes per player.

There are 3 types of cards in Q&V. Ideas, Quotes and Verses. During setup each player takes 3 Quotes and 4 verses.

The leader for the round will draw an Idea card and reflect on it. The rest of the group will then take turns using their Quotes and Verses cards to make a reaction to the Leader's sharing.

The Leader gives a point to the reaction they liked the most. The player next in line to the Leader starts the next round as the new leader. Play continues until everyone has taken their turn as leader. The one who has the most points win!

173374.name: Neuschwabenland
173374.description:
In the year 1938 the Third Reich undertook an expedition to Antarctica. The explored territory was called Neuschwabenland (New Swabia) named after the expedition vessel, Schwabenland.
Unnoticed from the rest of the world a secret base was built: The Base 211 and the Reich began to developed progressive weapon systems.
One day, troops on reconnaissance missions disappeared and there were sightings of strange 2m tall worm-like beasts and house-high creatures.
Due to the potential threat, the high command of Neuschwabenland caused a general mobilization to deal with the menace and to gather more informations about the strange creatures...

Neuschwabenland is a tactical hex and counter combat game for 2 players simulating the hypothetical struggle between forces of the Third Reich and the forces of Alien life forms, in an Arctic setting. The game is also highly suitable for solitaire play.

The Reich has advanced equipment and special units at disposal, such as the UFO-like flying machine Haunebu.
However, due to the harsh weather conditions they are limited when it comes to unit activation.

Aliens on the other side fight their enemies by sheer force of numbers and can activate all units.
While they lack the firepower of the Reich (with one exception, the Tripod: A monstrous killing machine), they are very dangerous in close combat.

The combat system is inspired by the game Space Crusade.

The game comes with a map (ca. 10 x 18 inch) depicting a part of the Antarctic region, Neuschwabenland, a sheet with 88 (5/8 inch) counters and 6 scenarios.

173375.name: Starlaxis Supernova Edition
173375.description:
User Summary

An action puzzle game. Match falling shapes to get your ship to perform different commands such as moving or firing weapons. Four upgradeable ships and six different character each with their own unique ability.

173377.name: The Motor Race
173377.description: A simple roll and move game. Players must race (using a die) to Home (Square 67). There are 10 squares with special instructions that must be obeyed should your car land on one. First to Home, wins.

173378.name: Bitwa na Ławicy Dogger
173378.description: Game covers the Battle of Dogger Bank. It was a naval battle fought in the North Sea on 24 January 1915, during the First World War, between squadrons of the British Grand Fleet and the German High Seas Fleet.

173379.name: The World of Big Trouble in Little Canton
173379.description:
From the Introduction:

Nothing ever happens in Ohio. Nothing good anyway. But the big, bad stuff? Happens. Every. Day.

Strange things skulk the city of Canton. Ancient Snake Gods run the strip clubs. Mouseanthropes infest the city dump. Ghouls consume us, and only the Amish have the faith to fight them. As evil reaches to tear out the heart of it all, who will stand against the coming darkness?

173380.name: Papilio
173380.description:
Papilio is a card game that recreates the life of butterflies in a fun and didactic way. It combines the fun of an enjoyable game with the discovery of the world of butterflies and some of the most common species in the Mediterranean area.

The aim of the game, fun apart, is to build the richest habitat, and this is achieved by gaining the maximum number of points: completing butterflies, attracting them with plants, trying to make them breed, or catching them (with final penalisation). You also have to ensure that neither predators nor changes in the weather nor human intervention have a negative influence in the strategy of each player.

The game is designed for 2-5 players of all ages, and especially from 6 years old to an adult public. We have devised three levels of difficulty so that the learning process is gradual until dominating all the aspects of the game.

The game has a total of 66 cards, and 40 of them represent butterflies, 17 are actions by the players and 9 refer to the weather. The butterflies chosen represent more or less the variety of diurnal species in the area and the majority are grouped by colours, an approximation to the different families.

Papilio is a game of simulation yet it is also competitive. This means that the dynamic of the game is agile and with continuous toing and froing, and at the end establishes a score in points that in some way is related to the concept of biodiversity and the biological cycles of these insects.

Thus there are more points for the butterflies that are free than those caught with butterfly nets. The diversity of the butterflies is also rewarded and the number of species of the same group. Finally, points are scored for the combination of plants and reproduction cards (caterpillars). Moreover, given the vulnerability of these insects, the game includes three species of protected butterflies, rare or in danger of extinction, species that in the game cannot be caught with butterfly nets.

173381.name: If I'm Going Down...: Penelope Character Card
173381.description:
Van Ryder Games gave this very special character card for If I'm Going Down to those who backed the "Tessen" Kickstarter campaign at the $12 level or above.

Penelope:
Recently reunited with her ex-lover Agent Zero in Livingston, Penelope was forced to explain her relations with Rigo. Now that he's dead, Penelope finds herself forced to examine if the feelings she once had for Agent Zero can be reignited...
Special Ability:
When making a Fate Check, Penelope may Trash a resource from her inventory to use the Fate Icon from that card.
Special Modifiers:
All weapons +1, but only if already bitten/scratched

Zombie side of card has a 3.

173382.name: Devaneas Arcineum I
173382.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder/3.5 Compatible Adventure for 3-6 PCs of Any Level

Every coin has two sides, every discussion at least two points of view, and magic is no different. If it came from just one source, think how much more straightforward being a spellcaster would be! But magic is strange and fascinating, a force that beguiles and can promise much whilst delivering little. Supporters of its varied sources and uses abound, putting their point of view forward whenever possible.

And so the PCs encounter Maaginen Jekku and Olemus Multa, two casters engaged in a seemingly-eternal discussion about the merits of various magics. Perhaps you have met them before, in a different time and place? Perhaps not, but then now is your chance! Maaginen Jekku has asked you to represent him in his testing gauntlet, with Olemus Multa providing the opposition, which could be anything. You will face foes that will challenge you at the very same time your own abilities catch you by surprise. You will be rewarded well, but may find there is no help that is better than your own skills, wits and perseverance. And you will find yourself changing as you face all that is put in front of you; indeed, it is difficult not to!

Such a demanding test will require help, and Maaginen will definitely provide that. After all, you’re each doing him a favour, so he is happy to, well, return those favors. What could be more rewarding than a life-changing experience that leaves you much more than you were before you started it?

Part 3 of the Dire, Devilish Deeds quartet contains:

A fresh, plane-spanning environment that is far from what it seems
The first 8 encounter areas of this challenging, arcane-fuelled gauntlet
Puzzles to test the skills of both the players and the PCs, with progress and rewards influenced by their degree of success
Traps with “helpful” results
New creature, the “Cave of Worlds”, which allows access to many and varied places across the multiverse
Chances to face combat at a variety of levels, in a variety of ways, as a variety of creatures
The opportunity for your PCs to take place in the greatest experiment known to humanoidkind and to influence the results!

173383.name: Devaneas Arcineum 2
173383.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder/3.5 Compatible Adventure for 3-6 PCs of Any Level

So far, so good, or at least it seems. For as you delve deeper into the challenge that is Maaginen Jekku’s testing ground, you find yourself facing more demanding puzzles and stouter foes. Yes, the rewards continue to be valuable, but the constant changes mean you have to frequently and suddenly adapt to new events and circumstance. How many more times will you have to face dealing with being in another body, another form entirely? Perhaps not too many more.

Of course, those with wisdom and intelligence may once again work out what will happen next. A distinct advantage may be gained if you can set up tactics and be mentally prepared for any further polymorphing. Because these encounters can only serve you well I the long run, as you grow to understand the tactics and capabilities of foes you may yet face, as well as gaining an understanding of how animal companions and familiars think and feel as they enter battle. Through all of this, however, is one main point; your minds and bodies will be prepared for more changes, greater trials, and the chance to be more than you have ever imagined once you have successfully met the challenge of Maaginen’s gauntlet!

Part 4 of the Dire, Devilish Deeds quartet contains:

The next stage of this arcane-fuelled, plane-spanning environment that is far from what it seems, including the final pan-dimensional shrine
The next set of encounter areas of this challenging gauntlet, more demanding than the first collection
Further puzzles to test the skills of both the players and the PCs, with progress and rewards influenced by their degree of success
Traps with “helpful” results
A chance to gain the thanks of representative of the gods, who can be more generous than you know
Chances to face combat at a variety of levels, in a variety of ways, as a variety of creatures
The opportunity for your PCs to take a place in the greatest experiment known to humanoidkind and to influence the results!

173384.name: Into the Village: Map 2
173384.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173385.name: Strange Stars
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
173385.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the far future, Old Earth is lost and shrouded in legend, and the children of paleo-humanity have long ago populated the stars, branching into new forms and strange cultures. Adventure is measured in light-years!

STRANGE STARS is a setting for any game where modern transhuman science fiction meets classic 70s space opera. Join a salvage mission to steal ancient tech from the wreck of a deranged sophont warship. Become a skiptracer in the lawless orbital megapolis of Interzone. Plan an elaborate data-vault heist on a diamond planet. Cross ceramic blades with a Zao Pirate in hard vacuum. Score sweet dreams or nightmare fuel from the oneirochemists of Eidolon. It's all somewhere in the STRANGE STARS!

173386.description:
Description from the publisher:

After far too long, your favorite space-faring munchkins are BACK! This expansion includes Ships your characters can use to explore the cosmos; a new Class, Ambassador, that can commandeer Ships from other players; and a new Race, Veggie, because even munchkins need fiber. Plus plenty of new monsters, Traps, and Treasures. (Yes, of course there are more Lasers. PEW PEW!) Star Munchkin 3: Diplomatic Impunity ... in space, no one can hear you squee!

Star Munchkin 3 adds 112 cards to the game, and the first printing of this expansion includes a bonus card (as noted on the cover). Said bonus card will not be included in re-printings of this expansion.
173386.name: Star Munchkin 3: Diplomatic Impunity

173387.name: Urban Dictionary Game
173387.description: In the Urban Dictionary Game, players mix words, definitions, pictures and names to form irreverent combinations! They can also draw or act out words and definitions to win over the judge and rule the round.

173389.name: Rush Hour Shift
173389.description:
Two players face off in Rush Hour Shift, with each trying to be the first to get their car to opponent's side of the playing area.

The game board represents a multi-lane highway with a number of trucks and cars scattered across the lanes. Each player starts with a hand of cards, and the cards let you either move vehicles, shift sections of the highway left or right, or both. Players alternate playing cards until someone moves off the far edge of the game board and wins.

Rush Hour Shift includes ten suggested set-ups.

173390.name: Abaku
173390.description:
Abaku is a numeric game for 1 to 4 players, who are lovers of numbers, figures, calculations and games! Everyone who knows that one and one gives two can play it. Playing Abaku significantly improves your calculating skills, logical thinking and intuition.

The players are using playing tiles to create numeric operations on the playing board. Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, squares and cubes of whole numbers and square and cube roots of whole numbers are allowed. The player wins over the other players – calculators thanks to the proper combination of each tile’s value and strategic use of premium squares on the playing board. The aim is to get more points than the others.
Numeric operations are created by adding (horizontally or vertically) one or more tiles to tiles already lying on the board. Newly created numeric operation must contain or adjoin one or more tiles lying on the board. Numeric operations must be legible from left to right and from top to the bottom.

Abaku is an effective supporting instrument for teaching mathematics.

173392.description: This is the second expansion to El Dorado Canyon. It includes two unique characters and 4 unique town cards to add to the game to give it more variety and replay-ability.
173392.name: El Dorado Canyon: More Ways to Die Expansion

173393.description: This is the first expansion for El Dorado Canyon which includes the starting cards needed to play with 8 players and 2 unique character cards as well. This expansion will increase the number of people who can enjoy this game at the same time and because of the simultaneous nature of the game, it doesn't slow down with more players!
173393.name: El Dorado Canyon: 7-8 Player Expansion

173394.description:
In each round of 10 Down, players are dealt ten cards. On their turn, they can swap one card at a time. The object is to create a sequenced run of cards from 1 to 10; that's a "10 Down" and you earn one point token! If you can create a color set, in order, of three or more cards (e.g., 7, 8, 9 yellow), you receive bonus tokens. The first player to collect ten points wins.

You may call your "10 Down" hand as soon as you get it, but you may want to press your luck and wait until you are able to build a color set of three or more cards to earn additional tokens. Keep in mind you never know when someone else is going to call. How long can you press your luck?
173394.name: 10 Down
boardgamepodcastepisode: GenCon 2015 - CSE Games

173395.name: Nefertiti Overdrive Quickstart Rules
173395.description:
From the Rules:

Welcome to a sneak peek/quickstart for Nefertiti Overdrive. This product is intended to introduce you to Nefertiti Overdrive in advance of a crowd-funding drive to bring the actual game to life. This product provides condensed rules,
pre-generated characters and an introductory adventure. It has minimal art and no maps. The crowd-funding campaign is intended to raise enough money so that the final product has more art and maps, as well as to pay for editing and graphic design.

In Nefertiti Overdrive, you are the greatest heroes of the 25th Dynasty of Ancient Egypt. You have assembled from across the Old World, your fate leading you to Thebes and the service
of the Kushite Pharaohs. This royal house is threatened both by the powerful Assyrian Empire – perhaps the greatest military force of the age – and an upstart pretender from Lower Egypt, intent on taking the Double Crown of United Egypt. Can you – the legendary warriors of this age – protect the royal house from conquerors and traitors? Can fists, steel, and will triumph over naked aggression?

173396.name: Nefertiti Overdrive
173396.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

Defying physics and common sense, you are legendary heroes protecting the royal house of 25th Dynasty Egypt from both internal enemies and the marauding Assyrian army. Do you want to leap from crocodile head to crocodile head before planting your sandaled foot directly in the face of an Assyrian giant bearing an axe bigger than you? Do you want to rebound off the side of a pyramid and fly into the centre of a mob of badguys, whom you then lay low with your lightning-fast fists?

Then you are our kind of people. Nefertiti Overdrive is a role-playing game of crazy wire-fu action set in Ancient Egypt. This is a game about kicking badguys in the face, or using a fallen foe as a step to get your character high enough to drive her knee into another bad-guy's face.

173397.name: Into the Village: Map 3
173397.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173398.name: The Last Days of Anglekite
173398.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is old. It has seen empires come and go. Its end approaches, and everyone knows it. Not least the residents of the last great mortal city—Anglekite, located in the Crater Basin. They don’t know when it will come, or how it will come, but they know that the end is nigh.

Maybe it will come in the form of the Scourge Karkis, the corrupted giant marching toward Anglekite to exterminate life out of a sense of mercy. Maybe it will come in the form of the Things From Outside, hoping to crack into this world and consume it entire. Or maybe it will come in the form of the Pyrewyrm, the massive fire dragon that is the death of the world embodied.

There are ways to fight the end. But each has its own cost. Draw in the corruption of the Things From Outside and grow powerful—and warped. Ask a boon of the demons of Pandemonium, and have demonic flesh grafted to your body. Wield the Angelbone Blade and smite your foes… and the world… with each swing.

Will the members of the Anglekite Adventurer’s Guild be able to stave off their world’s death? What terrible powers will they call upon in defense of their city? What price are they willing to pay for this dying world?

The Last Days of Anglekite is a Dying Earth-style weird fantasy setting for Dungeon World in which you play members of the Anglekite Adventurer’s Guild, the last line of defense for a dying world threatened by catastrophic powers. The Last Days of Anglekite draws from weird sword and sorcery tales and over-the-top fantasy by authors like Jack Vance, Clark Ashton Smith, and Michael Moorcock.

Through the efforts of Brendan, Mark Diaz Truman, Juan Ochoa, John Adamus, and Nathan Paoletta, it’s finally ready as a fantastic, fully laid-out setting book full of art, monsters, compendium classes, magic items, fronts, dangers, and madness.

The Last Days of Anglekite includes:

Adventure fronts, to fill the Crater Basin with dangerous threats and over-the-top quests.
Weird and wondrous monsters, to populate the Crater Basin with the remnants of old magic and lost civilizations.
Powerful and bizarre artifacts, each one useful and dangerous.
Compendium classes, providing opportunities for strength to those brave enough to seize them.
GM advice for running a game in the Crater Basin, including how best to play up the epic nature of the setting, and a whole new system for mass combat.
Advice for running a LongCon, the format of game for which The Last Days of Anglekite was originally designed.

173399.name: The Cold Ruins of Lastlife
173399.description:
From the Introduction:
What is The Cold Ruins of Lastlife?

Imagine grand cathedrals. Spires scraping the heavens. Statues of alabaster and silver. A song echoing through stone corridors. The light of hope ensconced in a thousand torches, keeping the darkest nights at bay.

Then imagine it all fell. Grand cathedrals, silent and empty. Spires, crumbling and broken. Statues dirty and tarnished. Song, forgotten and lost. A thousand torches, cold and dark.

That is the world of Lastlife.

This book—along with Dungeon World itself—provides you with everything you need to run a game in the ruined setting of Lastlife. Players take on the roles of the undead citizens, caught in an endless limbo of cold death. They, and they alone, can restore the world’s glory...or begin a new world in the shattered remains.

The Cold Ruins of Lastlife provides details on the broken, fragmented pieces of a once great world. Here you’ll find monstrous denizens. Relics that have survived past the end, or have been created since. Paths to power open to any who would take them, paths that may lead to greater darkness or newfound light. You’ll also find tweaks to the base Dungeon World rules to better reflect the tone and nature of Lastlife.

173400.name: The Green Law of Varkith
173400.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is centered around the Jade City.

Varkith is a city of success, corruption, democracy, and innovation, governed more than anything by the Green Law: “None in Varkith shall stand alone. The choice to be alone is the choice to be cast out.” To this city of guilds come countless immigrants, looking for new lives, for money and power and status on its many streets. And the statue of the Green Lady towers over it all.

The city is a tangled, uncertain web of opportunity...and danger.

Will you take your new guild to the top of Varkith’s food chain?
Will you successfully navigate the complexities of Varkith’s many peoples, each with their own culture, from the haughty and powerful Orkari to the sentient ant colonies called Krktri?
Will you use such wonders as Captain Toth’s Icy Elixir, or Dr. Iso’s Knife of Connective Processes?
Will you survive the strange fauna of Varkith, from the reaper mantises to the chitterswarms to the terrible Ursalok?




In this new Chaos World setting, written for the Dungeon World game system, you’ll play the members of a newly formed guild in Varkith, trying to make your way as the little fish in a city full of predators. This book contains everything your group needs to play a game of Dungeon World in this thriving city, including new rules for running guilds in Varkith; rules for ten different peoples, the primary denizens of Varkith; adventure fronts and dangers for use in the later parts of your Varkith campaign; a city’s worth of monsters, magical items, and compendium classes for this strange city; and more.

173401.name: Horizons: Empire of Istaria
videogamehonor: 2004 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
173401.description:
From the back of the box

Welcome to Istaria, a land of limitless opportunity and adventure. Here, as one of the thousands that make up the Living Races, you will strive to co-exist under the eyes of Gods and Goddesses ... and defend against the constant threat of the Undead hordes.

Enter this fantastic realm and experience a level of choice unmatched in the online role-playing world. Create a comprehensive online life that's uniquely your own.

For skilled artisans and brave warriors, recognition and fame await. At every step, control your destiny ... and perhaps, the destiny of others.

173402.description: One player rolls two dice and choose two cards (from the deck of nine cards). First card along with one die determines first part of the ball flight. First card is always revealed so your opponent can see it. In the first part of the ball flight, only important thing is that the ball cross over the net on the opponent's side of court. On that point your opponent can try to intercept your shot with volley, it is part of his judgement. The second card that, in combination with second die, determines second part of the shot is concealed from your opponent. That card tells which kind of shot did you choose (long shot, dropshot ....). In this part, most important thing for defending player, is to "read opponent mind" to anticipate wich shot will he/she choose to play.
173402.name: Tennis

173403.description:
MZM – Midnight Zombie Marathon

When Crazy Earl told us that Aliens were coming, we did not believe him. That did not stop him though. He put all his supplies into the sewer to protect them from tractor beams. Little did we know, zombies would soon infest the sewers and slowly take over your town.

Run, Dive and Dash your way past Zombies in the sewers. Find the hidden treasures of gas and food and barter your way out of town. If you are lucky enough, you might even find old Earl or his crash test dummy in your fun and crazy adventures.

This 1-4 player game is rated 13+ and comes with an easy to play rule book and personal deck with unique zombies to plague your adventures.

Single Player:

Game play revolves around running through the sewers to collect enough gas and food to barter with so you can get a ride out of town. Sounds easy right? We recommend you try to be careful because there is a limited amount of cards in the deck. The zombies will pop out of you, give you hugs and then go back into the deck. This creates a fun, creative and fun horde mechanic that is both simple and exciting. Can you get all you need before you have nothing left but zombies left in your deck?

Multiplayer:

There is only one seat in Earl's truck, and with so many people buying for it, it is up to you to out collect your friends.

While this setup is designed to work much like single player mechanic wise. The cards are no longer discarded, but go back into the deck to provide nonstop fun. With only ten rounds, you need to collect all you can before your friends do. How can you do this? Simple, bet your friends during their turn to try to wrestle their cards away from them and into your personal pile. Once all the players have a single card of their own, betting opens up and allows you to bet, roll and do whatever it takes to win. Do not worry... The zombie horde is still trying to hug its way to your brains, but can you outpace them and wave goodbye to your friends?

Follow us here at:

www.ArchNemesisGames.com
173403.name: MZM: Midnight Zombie Marathon
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 9

173404.name: All Queens Chess
173404.description: In All Queens Chess, each player controls six queens on a 5x5 game board, but unlike queens in chess, these queens don't capture anything. Instead players take turns moving one of their queens with the goal of getting four of their queens in a row. The first player to do so wins!

173405.description:
Only the strongest pimp can claim the coveted Pimp Island. Pimp Island is made up of four distinct districts known as Chinatown, Trailer Park, Chalupa Village and The Ghetto. All four districts contain three territories each. These territories, in addition to the central territory and four beach territories, make up the entirety of Pimp Island. America’s Next Top Pimp is a dangerous game of manipulation. Be wary of other pimps trying to take control of the island. The power of your hoes may not suffice. You must use the Police, Cardinals, Drugs and other manipulative measures if you want a chance at victory and complete control of Pimp Island!

America's Next Top Pimp is played over a few or several pimp rounds. During each pimp round, one or more pimp fights will occur. When all but one player has played their last card, new cards will be drawn and a new pimp round will begin. At the beginning of each fight, the player with the fight marker will place it on a territory of his/her choosing. This will be the location for the next fight.

Players begin each round with 10 cards each (8 in a 2 or 3 player game.)

During a fight, players take turns placing cards in front of them, forming their pimp hand. A player’s pimp hand shows the value he/she will bring to the fight. When all players finish placing cards, the fight is over. The player with the highest total value in his/her pimp hand controls the territory. A new territory is chosen and another fight takes place.

In a game of 2 or 3 players, the first player to control four territories that all touch each other or 5 total territories wins the game. In a game of 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 players, the first player to control an entire district, four territories that touch each other or 5 total territories wins the game.
173405.name: America's Next Top Pimp
boardgamepodcastepisode: Origins Spectacular 2015

173406.name: Go! Go! Nippon! ~My First Trip to Japan~
173406.description:
User Summary

After becoming friends with two girls you travel to Japan to spend the week with them. Travel to Japanese sightseeing spots and learn about Japanese culture.

173407.name: Hvem Ved Hvad
173407.description:
Quiz game for 3+ players.

One player is chosen as quiz master, and will hand out 3-4 cards. He then pick a player to read and answer the questions on their card; the scoring is as follows:
2 point for a correct answer
1 point for a partial correct answer
0 point for a wrong or no answer

The winner is the one with most points.

The exact date is unknown, but the first editions was with pre-1948 spelling rules.

173408.name: Legends of Empires
173408.description:
The most fascinating stories of humanity are passed generation by generation, surviving to time and space. Only those stronger, more prosperous, more enlightened, more wise will be remembered and will have their names stored in memory. You get to make your empire remains the pages of history? Will you be one more legend to remember?

In Legends of Empires, you take control of a civilization in the fight to be recognized as the largest empire in history. To win the game, you should invest in historical characters, build wonders, discovering new technologies , spread their faith in the world, and to maintain a military force able to protect their civilization, and all the resources are managed by dice.

173411.name: The Hobbit Hole (Issue 4 - 2000)
rpgissuearticle: A Totally Different Head About Trolls 1.1
Horses and Suchlike for Tunnels and Trolls
Letters from The Blue Frog Tavern
Quirks and Claws: Kin Definition for the Worlds of T&T
Weapon Lore: For the Discriminating Delver
What Makes A Player Good? A GM'S View!
173411.description:
The fourth issue of The Hobbit Hole zine. Contents:

Bearing the Torch - Brian Penn

Letters from The Blue Frog Tavern

Psyclop - Dany St. Pierre

Infernal Book of Psyclop Magic - Dany St. Pierre

The Forgotten World - Kirk D. Bailey

A Blast from the Past - James L. Shipman

What Makes A Player Good? A GM'S View! - Mark Rastogi

Pharaoh's Revenge - C. Bruce Hunter

A Totally Different Head About Trolls - Thom Kopf Laaki (Thomas K. Loney)

Artist Profile: M. L. Machuga

This Old House (Rules) - Jack Spencer, Jr.

Quirks and Claws: Kin Definition for the Worlds of T&T - Thomas K. Loney

Sliding Doors - Jon Hancock

Ariel - Graham Lloyd Buckinghamn

The Machismo Gizmo - Jon Hancock

Tunnels And Trolls: House Rules - Stefan Jones

Rule Variant: Luck - Jon Hancock

Weapon Lore: For the Discriminating Delver - Graham Lloyd Buckingham

Horses and Suchlike for Tunnels and Trolls - James Flowers, Matthew Towse, Daniel Towse

DireNeed: Dark Roleplaying for T&T - D. J. Burnett

"It's a Wrap!" - A particularly daft trap from the Dollport Campaign - Jon Hancock

A Sworded Adventure, a T&T Solo (Reprint from Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 5 - Winter 1979) - Ken St. Andre

Solitaire Adventure Design - Ken St. Andre and Liz Danforth

Individual Initiative in Solo T&T - A. D. Young

The Delver's Almanac - Joe Hildreth

A Kind of Magic: How to Draw your Strength from others - Jon Hancock

173412.name: Card Crash Demolition Derby
173412.description:
Welcome to the wild world of demolition derby! In the arena, nobody is safe and even taking out your opponents means you may be helping others take you out at the same time. To survive to the end you must learn to drive the line between aggressive and defensive driving and a little luck along the way doesn’t hurt either.

A 2-4 player take that style game in which you play cards to crash, bash and crush your opponents. If you can manage to survive to the end you'll find yourself crowned as the Demolition Derby King!

Game Contains:
4 Player Health Cards
8 Hit Cards
4 Defense Cards
4 Modifier Cards
4 Special Cards

173414.name: Towers Of Power
173414.description:
Race your team around the forests and swamps, icy tundra and lakes, caves and mountains, in a quest to collect to collect precious gold.

Fear not. If your character dies, you can resurrect her at one of the infamous Towers of Power and gain new special abilities, accumulating priceless gems and be one step closer to victory.

STYLE: Mostly Competitive
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

173415.name: Crystal Crisis
173415.description:
Your party must hike through a frozen wasteland, climbing mountains and crossing dangerous frozen lakes to track down the mysterious Snow Demon.

Collect precious Ice Crystals until you have enough to form the almighty Crystal Sword, then battle the Snow Demon atop a mighty Glacier.

This is a semi-cooperative game best with 3 - 5 players.

STYLE: Semi-Cooperative
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

173416.name: FunHouse Party
173416.description:
Travel through a mad dimension of fun and fear!

Players attempt to gain as many Fun Points as possible, while chased by the Clown Patrol, trapped in Endless Mazes and the frightening Hall of Mirrors!
Can you survive long enough before becoming Absolutely Terrified?

STYLE: Competitive
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

173417.name: Dig Dwarf Dig
173417.description:
Dwarves crawl through the dark caverns to drink 2000 Year Old-Ale, Mine for Copper and discover Weapons of Extraordinary Greatness.

Descend deep into the labyrinth to find the Mighty Lantern! Can your band of greedy heroes reach Level Six?

This is a semi-cooperative game best with 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

173418.name: Atrium: The ISB Game
173418.description:
ISB - The Indian School of Business - is a premier B-school (top 50 global schools as per Financial Times) and Atrium was designed to celebrate ISB's 10th anniversary and make players (re)live that experience.

To graduate from ISB requires 32 academic credits. However, there is more to ISB life than academics alone. The 1 year long flagship Post Graduate Program has parties, student clubs, networking opportunities etc. In Atrium, the objective is to get to 32 points through a combination of academic courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB.

Based on die roll, players accumulate time which they can use to collect academic, personal, or networking hours. Hours are traded for courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB cards in a race to be the first to get to 32 points

173419.name: Puzzle de Harvest Moon
173419.description:
Puzzle de Harvest Moon is a strategy game in which the object is to harvest plants from a small field you share with three other players. Farm animals the player periodically receives give special abilities in a small area; for example the dog protects an area for a short period of time from other players harvesting. Harvesting crops you've planted will count double towards your score.

Source: Wikipedia, "Puzzle de Harvest Moon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173421.description:
Those promo cards are special goodies to Cannes 2015.

The "Kaboom" card can be played only when a player must play a card. He indicates a player, and the bomb explodes immediatly.

The "Jump" card can be played only when a player must play a card. He chooses his right or left neighboor, who must play instead.
173421.name: Boom Bokken: "Kaboom" and "Jump" promo cards

173422.name: Outpost Raven Watch
173422.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outpost Raven Watch is a 1"=5' map for post apocalyptic settings. It is a military base built recently in the wastelands by a highly advanced, disciplined military organization with lots of resources to spare. In your campaign, they can be either a force for good, or a force for evil. Or they can be the very organization your PC's are a part of, and this is their base of operations as they explore the wastelands beyond!

Raven Watch may have been built using slave labor, or it may have been built by educated members of the organization that owns it. The builders may have recently left a bunker or vault with knowledge from the old world (engineering, architecture, construction techniques and materials, heavy equipment operation and repair, etc.) , or they may be common survivors that have learned architecture and building techniques in their travels through the wastes. For that matter, they may be slaves themselves.

No matter how it got here, the outpost is advanced. Recycled materials were used as much as possible (which can be seen in the floors and on the rooftops), but new cement foundations were laid for the outpost, to include cement walls, and each of the towers have thick panes of glass on the tops, allowing for good views of the surrounding landscape without fear of what the weather might be doing.

Some of the technology found here may or may not be found elsewhere in the world. From the fusion generators that power the facility, to the AeroChopper found on the landing pad. The organization running Outpost Raven Watch could be very progressive indeed!

You can use this outpost as a starting point for your players (if you decide to make them a part of this shadowy organization), or this can be a place where the players are captured and brought too to await processing and transfer to some other part of the wastelands. Or they could be required to assault the outpost, or infiltrate it using stealth. There is a lot of potential here, both dangerous and rewarding.

This map pack contains three levels - Ground level, the second level, and a third level showing the rooftops and tower tops of the installation. A print key is included to assist you with printing out smaller sections of the map if you choose not to do the entire thing (and each level is as big as most Stoneworker Cartography maps, so it is recommended you only print out what you need), as well as keys for figuring out which rooms are which within the facility. And as always, there are VTT maps of each level included for online play.

Features:

67.5" x 80" in size. Print out only what you need using the included print key.
Square Grid and No Grid versions, as well as a NO DECORATION version.
Full Color Version – This is a printer intensive, full color version of this map.
Black and White version – A black and white version, meant to be the least printer intensive.
Daytime lighting complete with shadows to give the map depth.
VTT Maps - Sized for use with any virtual table top software.

173423.name: Colony Center
173423.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 239th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a Sci-Fi Colony Center.

The map is 42 x 40 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 24 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4536x4320 pixels in size at 108dpi.

173424.name: The Ironclad: A Tinker Archetype
173424.description:
From publisher blurb:


I am Iron Gnome!

They bumble. They jangle. They barely function well enough to follow the simplest of orders. And yet the creators of these automatons beam like proud parents whose baby has just taken her first steps. It may be cute and all, but that sort of primitive functionality is liable to get somebody killed. That is, somebody on YOUR side killed. The way you see it, why develop a brain to put in an iron shell when you can develop an iron shell to put around your brain?

Specialized tinkers who eschew most of the trappings of the automaton inventor to create disposable suits of power armor for themselves, the ironclad tinker archetype is unique among tinkers for being durable, dangerous while flying solo, and capable of self-sustained flight.

The Ironclad - A Tinker Archetype is the latest expansion to Interjection Games' first base class, The Tinker: Master of Modular Mechanical Mayhem, proud recipient of position #9 on Endzeitgeist's Top 10 of 2013. Its expansions have gone on to secure position #2 on the Top 10 of 2013 and a nomination for the Top 10 of 2014.

Product Features

The Ironclad tinker archetype [Requires The Tinker: Master of Modular Mechanical Mayhem]
7 new ironclad-only innovations
8 new ironclad-only greater innovations

173425.name: Bleeding Hearts and Chocolates
173425.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Valentine's Day wear your heart on your sleeve and let the romance fly at the gaming table! Bleeding Hearts and Chocolate offers an assortment of goodies from romantic campaign traits, love spells, zombie prostitutes, love potions and charms, seductive npc's, and the Demiplane of Chocolate!

173426.name: 21 Villains
173426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where would the good guys be without the villains?

21 Villains provides 21 assorted antagonists to use against your characters. From street thugs to dictators, this volume has them all! Each villain comes complete with illustrations by expert artist Bradley Warnes and background history, stats and goals with which to challenge your characters.

Your characters can face off against such enemies as:

Sean "Shade" Marlette - A professional gambler turned high-class assassin for the O'Malley Crime Family. Well-known for his reputation of always catching his prey.
Martin St. John - A corrupt Cascadian politican working behind the scenes to increase his own power and line his own pockets.
Frode Falkanger - The ruthless narcotics kingpin of the Franklin Subsector!
Todd Chisholm - A slick talking confidence man moving from system to system and fleecing the unwary!
And many more!




While the book has been designed to be used in concert with the Clement Sector setting from Gypsy Knights Games, these organizations can easily be modified for use with any Traveller setting.

173427.name: 1-2-K3
173427.description:
From the publisher's website (Translated from Dutch):
Play with your favorite girl trio! The K3 board game is a real hit for kids that love K3. Try to collect as many K3 trios as you can by rolling the dice. Whoever collects the most K3 trios wins the game. Suited for kids ages 4 and up.

173428.description:
Star trails is a simple game for younger players. While playing children can learn about the solar system. The task to orbit the solar system with space shuttle and make photos of planets and asteroids.

Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to collect counters. Each counter brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.
173428.name: Star trails

173429.name: Into the Village: Map 4
173429.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173430.name: Into the Village: Map 5
173430.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173433.description: The DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League Playmat can be used by one player in a game of DC Comics Dice Masters to better lay out which dice are doing what during the game.
boardgameaccessory: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
173433.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League – Playmat

173434.name: Planarch Codex: The Path of Ghosts
173434.description:
Publisher summary:

The Path of Ghosts is a one-page compendium class for Dungeon World, offering 4 moves for thieves and assassins, including specialized moves for sneaking and climbing.

173435.name: Curious Creatures of the Dragon Isles
173435.description:
From the Introduction of the PDF:

The main part of this book lists dozens of creatures which can be used in your games – from the mundane to the wonderfully weird; from savage wild creatures through to sentient beings with their own sophisticated agendas; from the mildly dangerous to the downright lethal.

After the main listings, there are some random encounter charts, to be used by the Games Master to create wandering monsters appropriate to the terrain through which the Adventurers are travelling.
Finally, in the Appendix, all the creature statistics from this book and the Pirates & Dragons RPG Core Rulebook have been summarised into one table, so you can easily access a creatures stats in a hurry.

Note: Players of the '''OneDice''' edition of '''Pirates & Dragons''' already have statistics for the creatures in this book, but the text adds much more flavour on the habits and customs of these curious creatures.

173437.name: Road to Kak
173437.description:
From publisher blurb:

or those who trekked through Jeopardy Caverns and Urgoth’s Canyon a short trip to the north will land them on FV3 – Road to Kak. From this location the party can continue on their quest of fame and fortune with a variety of different encounters. Much like the canyon adventure this one presented different options of travel for a group of young adventurers.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

173438.name: Paracosm: Volume One
173438.description:
From publisher blurb:

BE THE ARCHITECT OF YOUR OWN COSMOS!

Paracosm: Volume One is a set of maps for the aspiring maker of the world. It includes five continent maps, each in three versions:

A base land map
A hex map
A political map




The political maps include suggestions for the boundaries of kingdoms and the location of cities and capitols. The names of kingdoms, cities, and capitols are all form fields, so that you can fill out the details of your world with ease.

Also included are two astrological star charts to help in fleshing out your world's cosmology, pantheon, or night sky.

The book is in 11in x 8.5in landscape format and all images are 300 ppi and handcrafted with the care of a loving deity.

No watermark is added, as this tends to cause problems on certain PDF viewers and would tarnish the sanctity of your maps.

173439.name: Into the Village: Map 6
173439.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map-pack features a single fantasy building that has been depicted in a vaguely dark-age (viking) style.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the building.
An unlabelled jpg image of the building (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap (printable at 1" per grid square).

173440.name: Into the Village: Bonus Maps
173440.description:
From publisher blurb:

This (free) map-pack depicts a number of simple outbuildings that can be used to complement both the Into the City and Into the Village range.

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet containing four small maps, along with space for the GM to add his/her own notes.
An unlabelled jpg image of each map (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square), for use with virtual tabletops.
A miniatures scaled battlemap for each map (printable at 1" per grid square).

173441.description:
Your old favorite book is now your new favorite game! In Bring Your Own Book, players take turns drawing prompts from the deck, then race to find the best phrase in their own book that satisfies the prompt. What's the tastiest “name for a candy bar” in that history textbook you're reading for school? How quickly can you find “lyrics from a country western song” in your dog-training guide? What kind of “advice for graduating seniors” will appear in your anthology of limericks?

In more detail, everyone has their own book and sits in a circle. The cards are placed face down, and the starting player has a one-minute timer. The starting player takes the top card off the deck, picks a prompt, and reads it aloud. Everyone except the Picker searches their book for text to match the prompt, sequential text of any length: a single word, half of a sentence, a whole sentence, multiple sentences, etc.

The first Seeker to find matching text announces "I've got it" and starts the timer. When the timer runs out (or every Seeker announces "I've got it"), each Seeker reads what they've found. Seekers who didn't find text in time open to a random page and read a random sentence from it. The Picker chooses their favorite submission and awards the card to that Reader. After each round, the person to the left of the last Picker starts the next round. Once any player holds three cards, everyone passes their book to the player on their left. This happens any time a player reaches three cards during the game. Thus, it can happen as many times as there are players.

The game proceeds until one player has collected the required number of cards and wins: with 5-7 players the first to 4 cards win; with 3-4 players the first to 5 cards win.
173441.name: Bring Your Own Book
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
21 – The Family Gamers Podcast – The #TeamCap Show
Podcast #26: Mostly Books and Wookies
Strange Assembly 190 - GenCon 2016 Preview

boardgameimplementation: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
173442.description:
Empires: Age of Discovery allows you to revisit the age of exploration and discovery. Take on the role of a colonial power seeking fame, glory, and riches in the New World. As you proceed through three ages, you launch expeditions of discovery, colonize regions, expand your merchant fleet, build capital buildings that give your nation distinct advantages, develop your economy, and (if necessary) declare war.

Empires: Age of Discovery is a reimplementation of Age of Empires III but without that name due to the expense of renewing the license from Microsoft. This edition includes the Empires: Builder Expansion along with its capital buildings; its National Advantage tiles have been built into the new player boards.
173442.name: Empires: Age of Discovery
boardgameexpansion: Empires: Age of Discovery – Bonus Capital Buildings
Empires: Age of Discovery – Denmark Player Board and White Figures
Empires: Age of Discovery – Ottoman Player Board and Gold Figures
Empires: Age of Discovery – Prussia Player Board and Black Figures
Empires: Age of Discovery – World Variant Components
boardgameaccessory: Glenn Drover's Empires: Age of Discovery – Metal Coins
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 92 - Top 10 Games Fixed By Expansions
BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
Episode 18: Codenames Review - Games of the Year - Giveaways
Episode 26: Star Wars Rebellion Review - Brawlers Maul
Episode 56- Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot and Gaming Relationships
The Board and The Ugly: Where’s the Good?! Episode 8 Board Game Publishers
The Long View - Empires: Age of Discovery
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 4

173443.name: Tao of Peg
173443.description:
What do Backgammon, Go, and Chess all have in common? They are board games that have stood the test of time. Built on simplicity but with potential for complexity these games provide a challenge for players at all levels. Tao of Peg is designed to use a combination of luck and strategy to win in a variety of ways. Tao of Peg is the perfect game for family fun or for more serious gaming nights.

The board and pegs are made of wood, and the board design is printed on a vinyl sheet and applied directly to a wooden base. The entire board is lightly coated with a protective varnish. Felt buttons are then added to the bottom corners to protect playing surfaces.

HOW TO PLAY:

Each player is dealt four cards. A player begins by discarding a card from their hand. The player then places a game piece in any space with the corresponding color on the board. The turns ends by the player drawing a new card from the pile.

In addition to the 100 colored playing cards (25 per colored quadrant), each set also has two types of wild cards. Players may play a wild card instead of a colored card. Red wild cards allow the player to remove any game piece in play and black wild cards allow the player to place a game piece anywhere on the board.

There are four different ways to win;

make a row of 5 pegs anywhere on the board
make a row of 4 pegs in a single quadrant
place a peg in each corner of a single quadrant
place a peg in each corner of the game board

173444.name: Victory's Vault Volume 1, Issue 07
173444.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

You can call her Phane Wonderra... she represents an ancient race that pursues the practice of Victory, and if you've got the cash, she'll give you access to the vault of their star fortress. They've compiled quite a stock of items with one thing in common; they've all proved their value in battle by being on the winner's side. Every item has been literally touched by Victory! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Phae Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

173445.name: Jolrhos Bestiary Volume One: Unique
173445.description:
From publisher blurb:

Allies and antagonists!

You won’t find goblins or giants in this book, no dragons or orcs or werewolves. What you will find are strange, unique, and excitingcreatures; creatures to stir the imagination and surprise your players with. With almost three hundred different creatures from the Accursed to the Zhar, this book is packed with friend and foe, and none of them fit the usual pattern.

What will your heroes do when faced with the fearsome Black Spore, or when they are hunted by the Prowler? What strange fate awaits those who encounter the Scarlet Polyp? Can your character master the Plated Steed? The Jolrhos Bestiary is filled with strange and wonderful beasts that can be found in the campaign world of Jolrhos, giving stats to the Boletid and the Geryon.

The Jolrhos Bestiary is a valuable tool for any fantasy role playing campaign. Packed with useful tips and information far beyond just lists of detailed and fully illustrated monsters, every GM will find something useful in this book!

173446.description:
This is a game for five players, but there are six figurines. Each player controls one figurine which represents one herbivore dinosaur. They move over one great valley in search for food and water. Winner is the player whose dinosaur eats most of the food (collects most counters). But, not everything is simple as it might seems so. More important thing of number of collected counters is their diversity!
The sixth figurine is tyrannosaurus. That figurine is moved by player when he/she finish move with his/her figurine. Tyrannosaurus is carnivore dinosaur, and if he gets him one juicy herbivore dinosaur, he eats it! (a player whose dinosaur is eaten is eliminatred)...this game is neverending race for various food and water counters, and running away from tyrannosaurus.
173446.name: Tyrannosaurus

173447.name: NUELOW Valentine's Day Special
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
173447.description:
From publisher blurb:

SOMETHING SPECIAL FOR VALENTINE'S DAY!

Roses, chocolates, stuffed teddybears, annotated copies of Fifty Shades of Grey... those may be heartwarming, but we've got the real romatic deal here: Comics and a ROLF! battle scenario!

The NUELOW Valentine's Day Special contains tales of romance, heartbreak (and even some lust thrown in for good measure) by great talents such as Joe Kubert, Steve Ditko, Alex Toth, and more! It also contains a Houseboat on the River Styx ROLF! battle scenario that pits legendary figures of romance against each other after they've been locked in a love maze by Cupid.

CELEBRATE VALENTINE'S DAY THE RIGHT WAY:
READ COMICS AND ROLL DICE WITH YOUR SWEETHEART!

173448.description:
Each player has a 1 figurine - car. While driving through the streets players have to respect all traffic rules. In each round the player must take 2 counters, one type A and one type B. Counters are deployed throughout the city. In each subsequent round of the counters are in ever more distant streets. When 2 players are playing, 6 laps are driven. When 3 players are playing, 4 laps are driven. ... When 6 players are playing, 2 laps are driven.

With this game is very easy to learn all the important traffic rules.
173448.name: Gradski Reli

173450.name: Mythic Britain Companion
173450.description:
Publisher blurb:

A PDF-only companion to Mythic Britain, featuring four full-colour maps (23" × 32" at full size) and additional content: the cults of Mithras and Sabrinna, the coastal kingdom of Bryneich, and an expanded treatment of the Great Spirit Lindis.

173451.name: dK2
rpgissuearticle: Ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls
Ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls
173451.description:
User summary adapted from the publisher website:

dK2 is the second edition of the dK System, 100% compatible.

dK System, is the simplest, most unleashed, most modular, funniest (and squarest), most heroic and most fantastic role-playing game system. Based on the success of the Open Gaming License for the d20 System, the dK System offer a simplification of the game mechanics with much more flexibility.

It takes into account the feedback gathered from the players community: more flexible, more fun.

boardgamepublisher: 同人ショッにゃんごろべりー (Doujinshop Nyanngoroberry)
173452.description:
User summary:
This game originated from an idea by Mr Asao, who operates the Doujinshop Nyangoroberry. It was agreed that Product Arts produce an edition for the international market, whilst Nyangoroberry produced a version for the Japanese market. As a result, there are several versions featuring the work of different doujin artists, labelled as 'Art of War the Doujin card game'.

Publisher summary:

ART OF WAR the card game is two-player card game that has theme of war and the founding a kingdom. You become a king, then you will increase the people of the kingdom while sending warriors into the battlefield, fighting against the opponent. You have a KING card expressing yourself, and only five other types of cards for making a deck, which you use to fight the battle.

The game uses unique systems such as logistic support, conscription and entry, combined with four different story-endings in depth, will not allow you to lose your concentration for even a second. At the same time, the exquisite sense of tension while seeking the countless winning endings will awaken your intellectual curiosity from deep inside!

Publisher summary:
"ART OF WAR the card game" は戦争と建国をテーマにした２人用対戦カードゲームです。あなたは国王となり、戦場に兵を送り込んで敵国と戦いながら自国の民を増やしていきます。あなた自身である１枚のKINGカードの下に、たった５種類のカードだけで自分だけのデッキを作り、戦いに臨みます。

後方支援、徴兵、入国、といったユニークなシステムと４つのエンディングが綿密に絡み合い、一瞬の油断も許さない緊張感と、無数の勝ち筋を発見する興奮があなたの豊かな知的好奇心を呼び覚ますでしょう！
173452.name: Art of War: the card game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 016 – BGG Con 2015 Recap Extravaganza!!

173453.name: Manuel des Joueurs
rpgissuearticle: Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
173453.description:
Translated from the publisher website:

In a galaxy that spread to the infinity, humanity suffering through violence and war struggle with the pain.

Cornered into four stellar nations, it attempts to protect itself against pillagers and mutants. But the leaders are consumed by the thirst of power and their armadas fight for the galactic supremacy.

Against this madness, men and women with a vailliant heart have decided to live their destiny. They chose a dangerous existence, but vibrant with freedom and exotism.

They are called the space pirates !

Metal Adventures : the role-playing game makes you discover the last millenium and play a space pirate.


This book is the player's manual.

173454.description: Formula 1 is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. 5 laps are driven. Everyone has to stop in the pit stop twice. Once for changing tires, and the second time to refill fuel. It is important to find the shortest path.
173454.name: Formula 1

173455.description: Zmajarenje (Hang gliding) is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. From the top of a hill located on a shore of a bay, kites fly over to the other side of the bay. While flying, kites should to make as many photos of birds, ships, .... In real sport kites are trying to stay as long as possible in the air. In this game the most points gets the last player who reach the finish line. Each photo (counter) also brings one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.
173455.name: Zmajarenje

173456.description:
A set of 48 replacement trains for 1860: Railways on the Isle of Wight, representing the vast majority of trains which actually ran on the island.

The original game's numbered trains are replaced with trains in lettered bands, and the trains in each band come in variations based on the original trains. So the eariest trains are 2+0s instead of 2+1s, but they cost less. Some are better than the norm and cost more. Some rust early, some late, and there are some slightly weird historical twists in there too, The later trains (D - H) operate in a slightly different way from the originals. The number of trains actually used in the game will broadly be the same as in the standard game, with one or two possible exceptions.

Depending on how players want to handle things, players can choose which train in the current band they buy from the bank, or the game can be played so the trains are available in a strict order, causing possible angst or joy.
173456.name: 1860: Locomotives of the Isle of Wight
boardgameexpansion: 1860: Railways on the Isle of Wight

boardgamedesigner: テイダ リョウ (Ryo Teida)
173457.name: Moefuda
boardgamepublisher: 哀愁旅館きたぐに (Aisyu Ryokan Kitaguni)
173457.description:
User summary:
萌札 (Moefuda) is a card game from Japan. In Moefuda, the players use cards (fuda) with 'Moe' elements, such as 'Tsuinte' (bunches or pigtails), 'Tsundere' (coldness turning to love) and 'Osana-najimi' (childhood friend). Gameplay resembles Apples To Apples as, while one player acts as a judge, the other players use their cards to form combinations from their hands. The players try to make the combo with the most 'Moe' (adorable cuteness) in the view of the judge. The winning combo gets the player a chip, most chips by the end wins.

A second version of the game 萌札女学院 (Moefuda Jogakuin) has a High School Girl theme and some changes in the voting method.

Publisher summary:
「ツインテ」「ツンデレ」「幼馴染」といった萌え要素が書かれた札を使い、子に選ばれた二人が配られた手札の中でできるだけ萌える組み合わせを考えます。審判役の親に選ばれた方がチップを獲得します。ゲームを繰り返し獲得したチップが最も多いプレイヤーの勝利となります。

173458.name: DI6DENT (Issue 0, 2013 reedition - Sep 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls
Inspi: Prince of Persia: les sables oubliés
Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Panoroma de la presse roliste Française
Quelque chose de pourri au royaume du Jylland
Y'a pas que le JDR dans la vie: Julien De Jaeger
Y'a pas que le JDR dans la vie: Willy Favre
173458.description:
User summary:

September 2013 reedition of the Issue 0 with supplemental content and a few updates. Was also available in print.

In this issue:


The match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Interview with Willy Favre
Thema: are RPG the black duck of the press - a look back at French RPG periodicals
Module for dK2: "ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls"

Players, electrify the table: improve your PC for a better game
